job_title: Analyst II, Digital Loss Prevention Analytics NA
job_description:
Open to remote work except in South Dakota, Vermont and West Virginia.
The annual base salary for this position ranges from $89,800.00 in our lowest geographic market to $177,200.00 in our highest geographic market. Actual salary will vary based on a candidate's location, qualifications, skills and experience.
Information about benefits can be found here.
WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH
The Digital Loss Prevention (DLP) team are experts at identifying fraud, abuse and systematic loopholes that result in financial losses in North America. They work as a team to deliver solutions that protect profit and reduce friction for our members to maximize investment in the business and deliver the best possible product to consumers. This role will report to the DLP Analytics manager and work closely with the DLP Quality Assurance and Fraud Insights team.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Data Analyst to join the NA DLP team. You will be expected to be a self-starter and an agile problem solver with comfort and curiosity in leveraging experience to solve complex data problems and learning new techniques as required.
The ideal candidate takes ownership in all 3 phases of great data work: technical excellence in writing efficient code/pipelines, implement strong data visualization principles to aim at business questions, turn information to insight and communicate to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, math, computer science, business analytics or related field. Will accept any suitable combination of education, experience and training
2+ years of experience synthesizing insights from data
Highly Advanced knowledge of SQL and relational databases; experience with concepts such Window Functions, Complex Joins, PIVOT/UNPIVOT, query optimization etc.
Strong understanding of data visualization principles and experience in with at least one dashboarding tool (Tableau, Power BI, Looker etc.)
Demonstrated ability to build self-serve tools for technical and non-technical stakeholders that answer common questions and/or increase data literacy across the organization
Ability to design metrics that help evaluate the health of the business and the success of our team, including any ETL development needed
Demonstrated ability to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured, hypothesis-driven and data-supported way
Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with Python/R for scripting, predictive and descriptive modelling, and data visualization
Experience with Tableau; including optimizing published work in tableau server
Familiarity with data warehousing tools Databricks and/or Snowflake
Experience in Fraud, DLP or digital commerce analytics
Background with analytics tools (Spark, Git, Jupyter) and cloud computing platforms (AWS preferred)
WHAT YOU’LL WORK ON
This role will provide support for Nike Direct Digital Loss Prevention in North America. You will use data to reduce risk from abusive customers and reduce friction and inefficiency throughout Nike Direct to all consumers. You will be encouraged to learn and deliver insights and solutions to improve operational efficiency. You will be considered a SME within the department and will be able to provide mentorship and assistance to internal and cross-functional teammates. You will be comfortable with end-to-end ownership of accurate and agile data products/dashboards and working in ambiguity to solve open ended business problems with all available Nike data sets
We offer a number of accommodations to complete our interview process including screen readers, sign language interpreters, accessible and single location for in-person interviews, closed captioning, and other reasonable modifications as needed. If you discover, as you navigate our application process, that you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please complete the Candidate Accommodation Request Form.

Being a part of our energy means being a part of endless opportunities and a growing team. Our Power Operations organization is looking for a Business Support Analyst to join their dynamic team! In this role you will be responsible for providing support to the regional manager, Plant Managers, and Operations Coordinators in the region. This includes administration of project finances, A/P, supply chain, payment requests, authorization for expenditures, and other duties as necessary to support the business needs of the operating facilities.
Does this sound like the opportunity you've been looking for? We would love to hear from you. Apply today! #joinourteam
What You Will Do:
Support processing of invoices, work orders, purchase orders, check requests for regional business.
Support A/P functions such as input, coding, and processing.
Support distribution of landowner payments.
Support site staff with vendor set ups and ISN issues.
Support expenditure and project administration.
Administration of marking and filing orders.
Support annual operations budget functions, such as preparation, project creation, and account verifications.
Who You Are:
A related university degree or technical diploma with limited experience or a combination of related certification and a minimum of five years of related experience.
Self-starter with a strong dedication to excellence.
Ability to work independently using sound judgement and attention to detail.
Great teammate focused on a results-based approach to support business activities.
Advanced computer skills in standard suite software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
Willingness to learn and train individuals as necessary with flexibility on task assignments.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Proven verbal & written communications skills.
Multitasking skills and the ability to work well under pressure.
Strong customer focus with the ability to make valuable contributions to both company & customers.
Physical requirements include but are not limited to:
Grasping, kneeling, light – moderate lifting (objects up to 50 pounds), reaching above shoulder, repetitive motion, typing, sitting, standing, visual requirement (able to see screens, detect color coding, read fine print), hearing requirement and the ability to work in tight spaces.
Mental requirements Include but are not limited to:
Ability to: understand, remember and apply oral and/or written instructions or other information, understand complex problems and collaborate/explore alternative solutions, prioritize thoughts and ideas into understandable terminology, coordinate and prioritize work schedule on a short-term basis, make decisions which have moderate impact on the immediate work unit and monitor impact outside this area, understand and follow basic instructions and guidelines, complete routine forms, compose letters, outlines, memoranda and basic reports and communicate with individuals via telephone.

Are you a IBM Maximo expert with a passion for reporting and system optimization? The Lower Colorado River Authority is seeking a Senior Business Systems Analyst to support technology initiatives within our Transmission operations. You'll play a central role in advancing our technology roadmap, working with IBM Maximo, SQL (Oracle & SQL Server), and Power BI to deliver impactful solutions across our systems.
You will be trusted to:
Serve as a Maximo subject matter expert, ensuring the system supports Transmission's Asset Work Management team by identifying functional improvements and aligning capabilities with evolving business processes
Analyze and report on Maximo data to provide insights into Transmission business operations, with a focus on compliance, work planning, and QA/QC
Build and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, and contribute to workflow improvements through the Microsoft Power Platform, including Power Automate
Leverage your understanding of Transmission systems to inform tool development that improves operational efficiency
Utilize TOAD Data Point for querying and analyzing data to support asset and work management needs
Collaborate with cross-functional teams using JIRA to track tasks, document issues, and support project delivery

You qualify with:
Nine or more years of experience in developing and documenting business requirements and serving as a liaison between business partners & IT or other relevant experience.
A degree(s) in business, computer science, information systems or relevant field may be substituted per LCRA guidelines for certain years of experience.
You are a great fit with:
Strong knowledge of IBM Maximo, particularly
Experience with Power BI and Power platform for reporting, dashboards, and workflow automation
Proficiency in SQL (Oracle and SQL Server) for querying and analyzing operational data
Familiarity with PeopleSoft, HTML, and TOAD Data Point
Understanding of Transmission systems or utility operations
Skilled in communicating with both technical and business users to gather requirements and explain solutions
Ability to plan, prioritize, and manage multiple workstreams, balancing quick wins with longer term-initiatives
A collaborative, problem solving mindset focused on improving user experience and system effectiveness

You gain:
Competitive salary & medical, dental, vision and legal insurance
Paid time off, including time for vacation, sick and family care leave
401(k) match up to 8% that includes a student loan 401(k) contribution program option
Life and disability insurance
Wellness program including wellness incentive
Extensive learning & development programs
And more - all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.

Senior Business Analyst
Position Type: Full-time salaried position eligible for performance bonus. This position will require working onsite in our Medford, MA office at least twice per week. Hybrid flexibility can be offered.
Job Summary:
The Senior Business Analyst plays a critical role in aligning business operations with technology solutions. This position partners closely with stakeholders across departments—such as Sales, Operations, Marketing, and Finance—to understand challenges, identify opportunities, and drive improvements through systems and data. The Senior Business Analyst helps define requirements, streamline workflows, and ensure successful delivery of technology-enabled projects that improve efficiency, scalability, and customer experience.
Essential Functions:
The Essential Functions are representative, but not all-inclusive, of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to perform this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.
Business Analysis & Requirements Gathering:
Partner with department leaders and process owners to understand current pain points, operational needs, and business goals.
Lead requirements gathering sessions, conduct stakeholder interviews, and analyze workflows to translate business needs into clear technical specifications.
Prepare and maintain business requirements, user stories, and process flow diagrams.
Cross-functional Collaboration & Solution Alignment:
Collaborate with Salesforce, Software, and IT Operations teams to ensure solution design is feasible, prioritized appropriately, and aligned with business objectives.
Support QA/UAT efforts and change management to ensure effective rollout and user adoption of tools and processes.
Reporting, KPIs & ROI Analysis:
Perform data analysis and reporting.
Analyze and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure project effectiveness.
Support the evaluation and communication of ROI for technology initiatives.
Perform additional tasks as required.
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, or a related field (Master’s a plus).
5+ years of business analysis experience, preferably in a fast-paced, operations-heavy environment.
Previous experience working in the field service industry (construction a plus!)
Strong understanding of business systems and workflows in areas like CRM (Salesforce), field operations, scheduling, and customer service.
Hands-on experience with tools like Jira, Confluence, Lucidchart/Visio, and Excel; familiarity with Agile and Waterfall methodologies.
Ability to work independently and cross-functionally, managing multiple priorities and stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; able to present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Python is a plus
Requires proficiency in reading, writing, and communicating in English
Supervisory Responsibilities:
This is an individual contributor position with no supervisory responsibilities.
Work Environment:
Hybrid position: This position is a flexible work model that combines remote and on-site work. When working remotely, the employee is required to have a workspace free of distraction during work hours to perform job duties.
Physical Demands:
Requires sitting at a desk for long periods of time, performing tasks on a computer, the ability to move within the office to attend meetings, access equipment, or interact with colleagues.
Equal Opportunity Employer:
At HomeWorks Energy, we celebrate diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we do not discriminate against race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, gender identity, or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, skills, and experiences needed to successfully perform the job.

Join Team CARFAX as a Senior Business Analyst!
Isn't it time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do, every day. We pride ourselves on being mission-focused on helping to grow a brand built on accuracy and integrity. We care deeply about our products and our customers. We’re more than just a company: We help millions of consumers make more-informed decisions every day. We know that our teammates are our most valuable asset, and we value a balanced life while tackling challenging projects in a fast-paced environment.
We’re seeking a Senior Business Analyst to focus on gathering business and technical requirements and helping implement a diverse set of projects within the Business Technology organization. You’ll work hand in hand with a driven set of technologists, project managers and business and technology leaders from across the enterprise. You’ll thrive in a team environment where you are well supported and can help launch “BEST-IN-MARKET” products to our customers.
What you’ll be doing:
Lead the eliciting, analyzing, validating and managing of requirements, business processes and high-level solution designs in partnership with stakeholders, project managers and technical teams
Identify system requirements; develop procedures and systems modifications to meet these specifications
Collaborate with business stakeholders and project managers to define project scope, and prioritize the product backlog
Create, refine and maintain user stories and associated deliverables such as process flows and test cases to meet stakeholder needs
Work with the business to thoroughly understand business needs to be supported by the systems and technology
Determine how project changes will affect business operations and systems
Respond to inquiries and provide advice to the business regarding current and potential system inputs, processes, and outputs
Perform detailed dependency analysis to engage the right technical teams for cross-functional solution building
Act as a liaison facilitating communication between technology teams and/or outside vendors.
Research, identify, and recommend software and applications that will improve the current state of systems
What we’re looking for:
A minimum 10 years of relevant experience focusing on both technical and business analysis, or with considerable experience delivering technical IT projects
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in IS, IT, or a business area discipline (i.e. accounting, marketing,) or equivalent education/experience
Demonstrated ability to execute on tasks that are sometimes vaguely defined using prior experience, analytical skills, and available research
Strong organizational skills that reflect the ability to perform and prioritize handling multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
Effective communication and leadership skills
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Experience creating sequence, data flow, and process flow diagrams
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and project documentation and requirements tools (e.g., Atlassian)
Familiarity with SQL-based relational databases including aggregating/extracting data from a SQL database and Business Intelligence Tools (e.g., Cognos)
Process engineering expertise to design and optimize business processes for enhanced efficiency and alignment with organizational goals
Understanding of Agile environments and experience writing user stories and conditions of satisfaction as part of the Agile / Scrum process
PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) or IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)
Scrum Alliance Certified Scrum Master (CSM) and/or Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO)
What’s in it for you:
Competitive compensation, benefits and generous time-off policies
4-Day summer work weeks and a winter holiday break
401(k) / DCPP matching
Annual bonus program
Great team and collaborative environment
Casual, dog-friendly, and innovative office spaces

Infosys is seeking a Regulatory reporting Business Analyst. As a consultant, you will interface with key stakeholders and apply your Business Analysis skills and Domain proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle including Project initiation, Requirements Elicitation, Application Architecture definition, Design and Testing. You will play an important role in creating requirements documents and in initial Data Analysis. You will also deliver BRDs, Requirement’s specifications for modules/applications, and lead validation for all types of functional/non-functional testing and support activities related to tracking, work allocation and status reporting. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.

Location for this position is Jersey City, NJ or Charlotte, NC or Atlanta, GA or Plano, TX. Candidate must be located within commuting distance or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel to project locations.

Candidates authorized to work for any employer in the United States without employer-based visa sponsorship are welcome to apply. Infosys is unable to provide immigration sponsorship for this role at this time.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
At least 4 years of experience with Information Technology.
Experience in Regulatory reporting / AML/ Capital Markets / Derivatives.
Experience in Trade surveillance, Data Analysis, SQL.


Preferred Qualifications:
Atleast 4-6 years of experience working in Financial Services industry, preferably Regulatory reporting / Risk/ /Capital Markets/Trade Surveillance.
Transaction reporting experience in Cftc, emir, Mifid II.
Strong processes experience in various financial instruments including Derivatives – OTC / ETD.
Well experienced with Data Analysis, analyzing, validating and documenting business requirements, preparing BRD, FRD, Use Cases, User Stories, User Acceptance Criteria and Backlogs. He should be is well versed with SDLC methods like Agile / SCRUM and Waterfall methodologies.
Experience in PPT to create business oriented presentations for Business Sponsors and senior management.
Experience in SQL, PLSQL, Python or any other data analysis tool will be added advantage.
Good presentation and articulation skills – being able to make presentation to senior leadership as required, manage effective communication between business partners and technology teams
Planning and Co-ordination skills
Experience with project management
Experience and desire to work in a management consulting environment that requires regular travel.

Job Description:
Seize your opportunity to make a personal impact as a Business Process Analyst Senior supporting Technology Shared Services (TSS) PMO team. GDIT is your place to make meaningful contributions to challenging projects and grow a rewarding career.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Business Process Analyst Senior, you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter.
GDIT is committed to strategic workforce planning and cultivating a pipeline of talented professionals for anticipated future needs. While there is not an active opening for this position at this time, we welcome expressions of interest from individuals with experience and qualifications aligned to the Business Process Analyst Senior role.
Submitting your information will allow us to consider you for future opportunities as they arise. We encourage you to apply if you would like to be considered when positions become available.
Thank you for your interest in GDIT. We value your desire to be part of our team and look forward to the possibility of connecting in the future.
HOW A BUSINESS PROCSES ANALYST SENIOR MAKES AN IMPACT:
Develop performance indicators to measure grantee progress towards programmatic outcomes and to identify performance baselines.
Designs and updates monitoring tools/instruments for quantitative and qualitative analysis of grantee performance and outcome-oriented data assessment.
Lead, harmonize, and assist in analyzing and documenting clients’ business requirements and processes; communicate and develop these requirements to technical personnel by constructing basic conceptual business and process flows (Visio), including data dictionaries, configurations business rules business requirements documents, system requirements documents.
Lead, harmonize, and assist in planning and designing business processes; assist in formulating recommendations to improve and support business activities.
Help coordinate and assist the creation of user acceptance test scenarios to be used in testing the business applications to verify that client requirements (e.g., edge cases, etc.) are incorporated into the system design.
Work closely with technical leads and developers to develop and modify systems requirements documentation to meet client needs and explore potential solutions.
Coordinate and sequence a myriad of detailed user stories and requirements to technical leads in support of sprint planning activities.
Execute demos and user acceptance testing assists in analyzing testing results in all phases.
Participate in technical reviews and inspections to verify 'intent of change' is carried out through phases of project.
Support Product Owners in their management of requirements and product features.
Lead and assist with the management of requirements and collaboration sessions using tools (JIRA and Confluence).
Assist in the research and assessment of business goals, objectives, and needs to align information technology solutions with business initiatives.
Assist Product Owner to define and prioritize the team backlog of work so that solution effectively addresses business and program priorities.
WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED:
Technical Training, Certification(s) or Degree, 3+ years of experience
Exceptional analytical skills.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Expertise with MS Office Suite, advanced Excel skills
Analytical Acumen, Effective Written Communication, Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E), Monitoring Programs, and Monitoring Tools
Working knowledge of Tableau software preferred.
GDIT IS YOUR PLACE
401K with company match
Comprehensive health and wellness packages
Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications
Cutting-edge technology you can learn from
Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays
The likely salary range for this position is $94,676 - $128,092. This is not, however, a guarantee of compensation or salary. Rather, salary will be set based on experience, geographic location and possibly contractual requirements and could fall outside of this range.

Total Rewards at GDIT:
Our benefits package for all US-based employees includes a variety of medical plan options, some with Health Savings Accounts, dental plan options, a vision plan, and a 401(k) plan offering the ability to contribute both pre and post-tax dollars up to the IRS annual limits and receive a company match. To encourage work/life balance, GDIT offers employees full flex work weeks where possible and a variety of paid time off plans, including vacation, sick and personal time, holidays, paid parental, military, bereavement and jury duty leave. To ensure our employees are able to protect their income, other offerings such as short and long-term disability benefits, life, accidental death and dismemberment, personal accident, critical illness and business travel and accident insurance are provided or available. We regularly review our Total Rewards package to ensure our offerings are competitive and reflect what our employees have told us they value most.

job_title: Mid-Senior Level Federal Financials ERP Business Analyst
job_description:
Position Description:
CGI is one of the top 5 largest global IT companies spread across 40 countries with endless opportunities to expand and grow. As a CGI Federal Partner, you have the opportunity to be a shareholder at CGI and join our family.

CGI Federal is seeking a Momentum Federal Business Analyst. This is an exciting full-time opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment supporting one of the largest organizations of the US Federal government. This program will retire the agencys existing legacy system and replace it with Momentum. We take an innovative and collaborative approach to supporting our client, working in an Agile environment using emerging technologies. You will be interacting with a dynamic team of people, with opportunities to learn and grow as you help deliver the overall solution to our client.

This position is located in our Arlington, VA, Lafayette, LA, Knoxville, TN, Belton, Texas; Austin, TX or our Lebanon, VA office; however, a hybrid working model is acceptable.
Your future duties and responsibilities:
Support external customers with analyzing current business processes, developing requirements, developing and testing solutions to client issues, and supporting end users.
Provide Federal Financials subject matter expertise.
Conduct analysis on problems independently, research and recommend solutions, and execute resolution steps to address client issues.
Provide functional support for testing such as developing test scenarios and documentation and performing validation testing for the core Momentum application and reports.
Provide functional support for new initiative implementation activities, such as requirements analysis, development of design and configuration documentation.
Provide support for federal government mandated initiatives.
Attend and participate in meetings with client stakeholders. Potentially lead client meetings.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst supporting a system implementation (requirements analysis, process design, validation, testing, implementation planning)
5+ years of experience with Federal Financials and/or Acquisitions ERP system (e.g., Momentum)
Experience working in an Agile environment (SAFe preferred)
Ability to effectively communicate and interact with senior level management and clients.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
An outstanding ability to establish priorities and meet deadlines.
4-year degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or similar.

CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and license and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is $67,800.00 - $150,200.00.
CGI Federal's benefits are offered to eligible professionals on their first day of employment to include:
Competitive compensation
Comprehensive insurance options
Matching contributions through the 401(k) plan and the share purchase plan
Paid time off for vacation, holidays, and sick time
Paid parental leave
Learning opportunities and tuition assistance
Wellness and Well-being programs

Baptist Health is the region’s largest not-for-profit healthcare organization, with 12 hospitals, over 28,000 employees, 4,500 physicians and 200 outpatient centers, urgent care facilities and physician practices across Miami-Dade, Monroe, Broward and Palm Beach counties. With internationally renowned centers of excellence in cancer, cardiovascular care, orthopedics and sports medicine, and neurosciences, Baptist Health is supported by philanthropy and driven by its faith-based mission of medical excellence. Overview:Our IT Business Analyst-MES resource is responsible for Manufacturing Execution System (MES) software across Piston Automotive plants. They are responsible for ensuring the success of concurrent systems and technology projects and delivering effective information systems that meet external or internal customer, schedule and budgetary requirements. Piston currently runs a custom, legacy solution as well as purchased solutions. We are currently planning implementations using MAN-IT from Via. Experience with other MES software is acceptable. Demonstrated automotive MES experience is required. Detailed familiarity with labeling, scanning, inventory, shipments, financials, materials, procurement, integration, etc. As mentioned above, sequencing experience with 866, broadcast, etc. would be preferred but that can be trained if necessary. This position will liaise with plant personnel at each facility to ensure MES operations achieve operational expectations. This often entails business process definition, technical solution design, configuration and validation of MES-PLC and MES-ERP integration in a lab environment. The position is also responsible for training and coaching plant users and system administrators on MES functionality, systems management, troubleshooting, and best practices. Piston Automotive is constantly in launch mode. The person would closely liaise with program management and control engineering to ensure the successful launch of all IT solutions.
*
Piston Automotive* wasn’t just founded to make things. It was founded to make things better. And that begins with building better teams solely dedicated to achieving excellence at every level of execution through a combination of experience, expertise, and a deep seeded passion for what we do. Our assemblies consistently set the standard because our people consistently raise the bar.
*
Why Piston Automotive?*

job_title: Sr Workday HRIS Analyst, Talent Management & Talent Acquisition
job_description:
Senior Workday HRIS Analyst, Talent Management & Talent Acquisition
The Senior HRIS Analyst is responsible for the configuration, maintenance, and optimization of the Workday Human Capital Management system to support business needs and operational efficiency. This role serves as a subject matter expert for the Talent Management, Talent Optimization, Peakon, Talent Acquisition Workday modules. This Senior HRIS analyst will lead system projects in these spaces, architect solutions, test, deploy, and develop custom reports and dashboards to support data-driven decision-making. Responsibilities also include managing testing for configuration changes, maintaining end-user documentation, maintaining complex security administration, and contributing to HR reporting strategies and analytics.
The analyst collaborates with stakeholders to assess requirements to match Human Resources policy updates, recommend system enhancements and process improvements, and ensure data integrity across HR operations. We are seeking someone who thrives in a fast paced, autonomous, and team-focused atmosphere with a focus on continuous improvement and simplicity.
Configure and maintain Workday system functionality, including business processes, reports, data loads, integrations, eligibility rules, calculated fields, and security roles.
Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) for assigned Workday modules, ensuring the platform meets evolving business and user needs
Talent Management: including Peakon, Manager Insights Hub, Performance Management, Calibration and succession planning, Talent Optimization, Skills
Talent Acquisition: Candidate Management (application workflow and questionnaires), Maintain Career Sites, Interview and job application process configuration and notifications, offer, ready for hire, and onboarding business processes
Peakon: survey design, user management, mass operations management and integrations, insights and analysis
Lead and manage Workday-related projects and enhancements, overseeing scope, timelines, and resource coordination to ensure successful implementation.
Analyze business processes and recommend system enhancements to improve efficiency, accuracy, and data integrity across HR operations
Collaborate with business stakeholders to assess requirements, identify automation opportunities, and provide consultative solutions aligned with organizational strategy.
Execute and coordinate comprehensive testing efforts for Workday configuration changes, releases, and upgrades to ensure functionality and mitigate risk.
Design and develop custom reports, hubs, dashboards, and scorecards using Workday reporting tools and calculated fields to support data-driven decision-making.
Create and maintain end-user documentation, including job aids and training materials, to enhance Workday adoption and system utilization.
Actively engage in Workday Community forums and user groups to stay informed on system updates, best practices, and potential solutions.
Preferred Experience/Qualifications
5+ years of Workday configurator or systems administrator roles (preferably in Core HCM, Reporting and Analytics, Security, Talent Acquisition, Talent Management)
Experience with Unions and administering Collective Bargaining Agreements (CBAs)
3-5+ years experience in Talent Management, Talent Acquisition, and Peakon Employee Engagement
Workday experience in EIBs, MOM
Excellent interpersonal, collaboration, analytical and complex problem-solving skills.
Strong prioritization, project management, planning and organization skills.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams, explain complex concepts, bring business insights, and drive process improvements.

job_description:

NIKE, Inc.’s uncompromising focus on human potential extends to its workforce. Nike Human Resources teams help attract, retain, and reward the world’s most innovative people by creating programs to help them thrive. They accelerate company growth as stewards of culture, organizational effectiveness, talent and change. The global Human Resources community includes experts in talent planning, talent acquisition, talent development, compensation and benefits, employee relations and more. Together, they develop a motivated, diverse and engaged global team.
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
The Lead, Global Process Analyst Role (Compensation) will serve as a Subject Matter Expert supporting Nike’s Compensation-related operations and initiatives! This role will be a member of our Hire-to-Retire Global Process Owner organization and will partner with peers in key geographies and/or global teammates on implementation and ongoing management of our processes and technologies (predominantly Workday). This role is responsible for providing input on solutions to enable the business strategy and will serve as the front door to technology for intake, prioritization, and solutioning for our HR teammates!
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
Strategic:
Identify and advocate for enhancements to HR system functionality that align with evolving business strategies and organizational goals.
Collaborate with H2R Global Process Owners to execute on H2R Features Roadmap
Champion the standardization, governance, and continuous improvement of global HR processes to support scale, efficiency, and compliance
Lead efforts to streamline and optimize end-to-end (E2E) processes, with a relentless focus on delivering an exceptional Teammate experience.
Operational:
Root cause analysis of issues and requests to identify and recommend solution options
Engage with stakeholders to gather and document requirements; analyze and translate business requirements into technical requirements and system solutions
Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and scripts to validate configurations
Support Global Process Owners in monitoring system performance, teammate feedback, and process effectiveness—identifying opportunities for ongoing optimization.
Ensure full compliance with data governance frameworks, privacy regulations, and internal controls.
Document E2E Processes, requirements, testing scenarios and evidence, and system steps in customer facing knowledge base articles; support readiness and training activities and H2R GPO team documentation
Obsess over data quality and integrity
Monitor and manage incoming ServiceNow cases, ensuring timely and accurate resolution – consistently achieving or surpassing 90% SLA
Leadership:
Stay ahead of emerging trends, features, and best practices in Workday, ServiceNow, and other HR technologies to proactively recommend innovative solutions.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to achieve project goals
Serve as a guardian of HR data, policies, processes, and procedures - ensuring data quality, privacy, and security within HR Systems
Bring a solution-oriented, innovative mindset to every initiative—placing the Teammate Experience at the heart of every decision/solution

WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
COE & Operational/Delivery Teams to understand process/functional gaps, partner on delivery related activities, support escalated issues
HR Tech (Engineering & Product) to partner on the delivery of enhancements to HR Systems
Global Process Owners to identify and recommend solution options, define requirements, test configurations, support training and readiness activities
Payroll Systems to partner on pay impacting data and processes

WHAT YOU BRING
Bachelor’s degree in HR, Business, or related field. Will accept any suitable combination of experience, education, and training.

Workday experience is preferred, especially with Reporting, Compensation, and Advanced Compensation Modules (Merit/Bonus/Stock Compensation Planning, Step Progression, Job Catalog, Pay Ranges, Various Compensation Plans, Business Processes, etc)
Curiosity – desire and drive to learn, understand, and explore new concepts and solutions
Proficiency in designing and documenting End-to-End H2R processes
Deep understanding of HR Systems supported by the H2R GPO team, including functionality, security, and integration capabilities
Ability to analyze complex business processes and translate them into effective HR system and process solutions
Strong problem-solving skills – ability to troubleshoot issues, identify root causes, and implement timely resolutions
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Ability to articulate technical concepts and information to non-technical audiences, and vice versa
Proficiency in Agile methodology and tools, i.e., Jira, Confluence

Drive continuous improvement by identifying, designing, and implementing process automation, optimizing data delivery, and enabling greater scalability.

Providing innovative solutions to support analysis and insights for Finance teams.
Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis as needed.

4+ years of relevant experience in Data Analytics, Data Modelling and Data Visualization, including:
Data Modeling using SQL
Data visualization using Power BI or SAC or Tableau
Version control using Azure DevOps or Git
Data Warehouse platforms such as Snowflake
Ability to visualize and communicate complex data in a clear, actionable way
Strong customer focus, with a passion for analytics and product quality.

Finance background

Experience using Python and/or R for data science, analytics, and statistical modeling

The Enterprise Operational Analyst will play a key role in driving the business process optimizations and automation initiatives across the enterprise. Under
the leadership of the Deputy Director of Enterprise Business Solution Architect, this position focuses on analyzing current business processes, identifying inefficiencies and gaps, and recommending automation opportunities to enhance operational efficiency and reduce manual effort. The Analyst will bridge the gap between business needs and technology solutions by delivering actionable insights, supporting solution design efforts, and producing high-quality documentation to implement process improvements.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner with business units and product owners to evaluate and document existing business processes to identify inefficiencies and automation opportunities.
Assess complex business processes by conducting gap analysis and recommend improvements aligned with strategic goals.
Identify bottlenecks, redundancies, and automation opportunities.
Create a future state solution design document for process optimization including exception processes.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and validate business processes enhancements recommendations
Support the design and implementation of automation solutions in partnership with technical teams.
Document workflows, requirements, and solution designs with clarity and precision.
Monitor post-implementation performance and support continuous improvement efforts.
Ensure alignment between business objectives and technology capabilities.
Create and maintain user stories, solution requirement documents, and workflow diagrams to support solution design and development.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.
Collaborate with Risk, Audit, and Legal teams as needed.
Participate in vendor demos and/or vendor meetings related to automation opportunities provided by third party partners and document the business requirements required to leverage federated solutions (i.e. work with Contact Center or OLB vendors related to bots or AI features).
Perform other duties as assigned.
SKILLS, EDUCATION, & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, information systems, computer science, or a related field required.
6 + years of experience in business analysis, data analytics, or systems analysis.
Business Analyst Certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA, Lean Six Sigma, or RPA tools like UiPath Academy) are a plus.
Strong foundational knowledge in business analysis methodologies, process modeling, and enterprise systems.
Familiarity with automation tools and platforms such as UiPath, Automation Anywhere, or Microsoft Power Automate is a plus.
Experience documenting user stories and solution requirements in Agile or hybrid environments.
Experience or knowledge of Large Language Models (LLM), Microsoft CoPilot, Agentic AI, or other AI experience a plus
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Experience of working in cross-functional teams and agile environments.

In this role, the analyst will use their expertise in data analysis, process optimization, and strategic recommendations to find inefficiencies, develop and implement solutions, and track their impact on key performance indicators (KPIs). This is an opportunity to significantly enhance the organization's efficiency and effectiveness, collaborating with teams to streamline workflows and deliver results. Company laptop and smartphone

Working closely with cross-functional teams (including finance, sales, IT, and HR) to understand operational needs and implement changes.
Facilitating discussions, gathering insights from employees across departments, and collaborating on solution development and implementation.

At St Cloud Financial Credit Union, we are passionate about our vision to make a meaningful difference through human connection. Each employee will demonstrate our core values and mission: To make a difference for all, we advocate for people through a member-focused culture, an enthusiastic employee environment, and purposeful action within our community.
The Business Systems Analyst serves as the primary owner and contributor to the administration, maintenance, enhancement, and optimization of the Credit Union’s business tools and systems. This role bridges business needs and technology solutions by aligning systems capabilities with organizational strategy.
Partnering closely with the IT Technical Director, this position focuses on process improvement, operational efficiency, and technology enablement across the organization. The Business Systems Analyst plays a key role in supporting and advancing our core systems including Keystone/Corelation, FastDocs, and other business platforms.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities:
Process Improvement & Efficiency: Analyzes existing systems and workflows to identify technical and operational inefficiencies. Recommends and implements process improvements that enhance efficiency, user experience, and business outcomes across departments. Provides technical guidance to management and staff on effective application design and workflow utilization.
Business & Technical Analysis: Partners with stakeholders at all levels to understand information requirements and operational goals. Gathers and documents business requirements, translates them into system specifications, and ensures alignment with the Credit Union’s strategic vision and technology roadmap.
System Administration & Enhancement: Administers, supports, and enhances key business systems, including Keystone/Corelation, FastDocs, and other related platforms. Ensures systems are configured for maximum functionality, performance, and integration efficiency. Serves as the main technical owner of all business functional systems.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Leads and facilitates cross-departmental teams to define, design, and implement technology solutions that optimize workflows, improve data quality, and enhance member service. Collaborates closely with the IT Technical Director on strategic technology initiatives.
Data Optimization & Support: Oversees shared data movement routines, ensuring data integrity and accuracy. Troubleshoots issues, develops reporting improvements, and provides guidance on optimizing business intelligence and reporting tools.
Continuous Improvement & Learning: Actively participates in industry networking groups and councils. Stays informed on credit union technology trends and best practices to ensure the organization maintains leading-edge systems and processes.
Other Duties: Performs other job-related duties as assigned to support departmental and organizational objectives.
Performance Measurements:
1. Demonstrates consistent delivery of business and technical solutions aligned with strategic objectives.
2. Effectively manages projects from inception through implementation and evaluation, ensuring timeliness and quality outcomes.
3. Maintains internal controls and documentation in compliance with Credit Union policies, procedures, and audit requirements.
4. Keeps management informed of key operational or system issues affecting performance.
5. Demonstrates continuous improvement in application and process design to reduce inefficiencies and improve member and employee experience.
6. Provides professional, knowledgeable, and responsive service to all staff and members.
Knowledge and Skills:
Experience Five to ten years of progressively responsible experience in business systems analysis, process improvement, or IT project management — preferably in a financial institution or credit union environment.
Education Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Relevant certifications (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA, or Technical certifications) preferred.
Interpersonal Requires a high degree of diplomacy, collaboration, and influence. Must be able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, build trust across teams, and foster strong vendor and partner relationships.
Other Skills Demonstrates a strong blend of technical aptitude and business acumen, with the ability to align complex systems with organizational objectives. This role requires advanced project management skills and familiarity with methodologies such as Agile or Lean Six Sigma to drive process improvement and operational efficiency. A solid understanding of business process modeling, systems integration, and data management is essential, along with experience working with core credit union systems such as Keystone/Corelation and FastDocs. The individual must possess exceptional analytical thinking, attention to detail, and problem-solving abilities, supported by excellent written and verbal communication skills. This position requires the ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and collaborate effectively across departments. Basic programming or scripting experience is beneficial and represents approximately five percent of the overall responsibilities.

job_title: Business Performance Analyst, Technical Training Development - Performance
job_description:
Job Description

Marketing Statement:
Drive impactful change through data-driven insights and strategic analysis! The Technical Training and Development department is seeking two forward-thinking Business Performance Analysts to elevate organizational effectiveness by transforming complex data into clear, actionable insights. This role is central to developing and evaluating performance metrics, uncovering root causes, and guiding learning and development efforts toward smarter, more efficient operations. From crafting compelling visualizations and facilitating performance reporting to coordinating cross-functional data efforts and supporting risk mitigation strategies, the Analyst will be a trusted internal consultant, empowering teams with the tools and insights needed to drive continuous improvement. The ideal candidate thrives on analytical challenges, excels in translating data into meaningful narratives, and brings clarity to complex organizational dynamics.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Education
Bachelor Degree in Mathematics/Statistics; Data Science; Financial Management; Economics; Public-Business Administration; Engineering; Political Science; Planning and History, or a related field
In lieu of a Bachelor Degree, a High School Diploma/GED and four (4) years of quantitative analysis, metric development, and data modeling experience, in addition to the experience stated below, will be considered.
Experience
A minimum of four (4) years of experience involving quantitative analysis, analytical problem solving, metric development, data modeling and visualization and/or business strategy implementation.
Certification/Licensure
Valid Driver License
Preferred
N/A
Medical Group
Satisfactorily complete the medical examination for this position, if required. The incumbent must be able to perform the essential functions of this position either with or without reasonable accommodations
SUMMARY
The Business Performance Analyst collects, analyzes, documents, and communicates performance measure data results internally. Working on behalf of internal programs, the Business Performance Analyst conducts root-cause analysis to improve the performance of internal programs, drafts recommendations for managers and prepares visualizations that clarify results. The Business Performance Analyst facilitates business plan development at the department and office level and interacts regularly with managers to inform internal performance measurement reporting. The incumbent also performs departmental strategic assessments, efficiency analyses, budgeting, and financial reporting, as well as conducts special departmental studies and analyzes expense trends and budget variances to direct future monthly expenditures and adjustments and to ensure efficient management of department resources.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Collects, analyzes, documents, and prepares internal reports on performance measures to evaluate how effectively the department is meeting strategic goals, business plan objectives and/or mitigating risks.
Analyzes measures not performing at target to discover and document root-cause and applicable business processes impacted.
Prepares and communicates performance analysis results and recommendations to supervisor and internal programs, utilizing tables, graphs, PowerPoint presentations, and narratives.
Gathers feedback from managers on performance reporting needs and summarizes in narrative format for supervisor and leadership review.
Gathers program performance data and customer comments and compiles information for the generation of monthly key performance indicator (KPIs) reports for supervisor and leadership review.
Supports department¿s business plan development by interviewing managers and documenting core services, key accomplishments, priorities, actions, performance measures and risks to achieving strategic goals.
Completes detailed analysis of departmental annual operating budget submissions, monthly expense trends, and budget variances to ensure compliance within the allocated budget
Prepare cost analysis crosswalk reports to determine best price for office supplies, materials, and vendor services.
Prepares routine reports for supervisor and leadership review to ensure compliance with policy and instructions and safety training requirements
Performs high-level analysis of Authority-wide transit data for trends in areas of safety to assist in quality assurance internal audits and reviews to mitigate risks.
Serves as internal consultant to leadership and managerial staff as it relates to routine monitoring of data results, clarifying challenges and bringing insights to facilitate process improvement.
Works in collaboration with department program teams to coordinate receipt of completed team training to include in departmental training matrix master database.
Coordinates routine updates to Department Continuity of Operations Plan (COOP) and assists in planning scheduled and unscheduled drills to ensure compliance with COOP protocols.
The functions listed are not intended to limit specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Nor is it intended to limit in any way the right of managers and supervisors to assign, direct and control the work of employees under their supervision.
Evaluation Criteria
Consideration will be given to applicants whose resumes demonstrate the required education and experience. Applicants should include all relevant education and work experience.
Evaluation criteria may include one or more of the following:
Skills and/or behavioral assessment
Personal interview
Verification of education and experience (including certifications and licenses)
Criminal Background Check (a criminal conviction is not an automatic bar to employment)
Medical examination including a drug and alcohol screening (for safety sensitive positions)
Review of a current motor vehicle report
Closing
WMATA is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by applicable federal law.
This posting is an announcement of a vacant position under recruitment. It is not intended to replace the official job description. Job descriptions are available upon confirmation of an interview.

Santa Clara Family Health Plan (SCFHP) is a local, community-based health plan dedicated to improving the health and well-being of the residents of Santa Clara County. About the role:
This posting is for one position and will be filled as either a Business Systems Analyst I, Business Systems Analyst II, or a Business Systems Analyst III depending on the candidate's qualifications and experience.
We are looking for a BSA candidate who possesses strong technical skills with a focus on reporting and data analysis. The candidate should be skilled in SQL and have an understanding of programming languages to support code review and interpretation. The position will require adept critical thinking and problem-solving skills. The position will be responsible for developing and maintaining regulatory reports related to Case Management, Utilization Management, Claims, Members, Grievances, and Appeals.
Business Systems Analyst I - Troubleshoot small-scale, basic production system issues, including thoroughly reviewing the initial service request, efficiently gathering additional information as needed from the service requester and subject matter experts, performing comprehensive critical thinking to identify root cause, documenting findings and resolution, and working with manager to determine appropriate escalation path, if applicable.
Business Systems Analyst II - Troubleshoot small to medium scale, basic to moderate production system issues, including thoroughly reviewing the initial service request, efficiently gathering additional information as needed from the service requester and subject matter experts, performing comprehensive critical thinking to identify root cause, documenting findings and resolution, and working with manager to determine appropriate escalation path, if applicable.
Business Systems Analyst III - Troubleshoot small to large scale, basic to complex production system issues, including thoroughly reviewing the initial service request, efficiently gathering additional information as needed from the service requester and subject matter experts, performing comprehensive critical thinking to identify root cause, documenting findings and resolution, and working with manager to determine appropriate escalation path, if applicable.
Day to Day:
Business Systems Analyst I - Process improvement and documentation for small-scale, basic projects and components of medium-scale projects; writing formal requirements and functional specifications following industry standards and departmental templates; creating process flow diagrams; overseeing implemented changes; communicating impact to affected business areas.
Business Systems Analyst II - Process improvement and documentation for small to medium scale, basic to moderate projects and components of large scale projects; writing formal requirements and functional specifications following industry standards and departmental templates; creating process flow diagrams; overseeing implemented changes; communicating impact to affected business areas.
Business Systems Analyst III - Process improvement and documentation for small to large scale, basic to complex projects; writing formal requirements and functional specifications following industry standards and departmental templates; creating process flow diagrams; overseeing implemented changes; communicating impact to affected business areas.

Experience in healthcare and Knowledge of healthcare management information systems.
Knowledge of healthcare business processes and knowledge of healthcare analytics and standard reporting measures.
Knowledge of project management standards and functions and ability to analyze data for the purpose of informing business decisions.

Minimum two years of experience as a business analyst. Minimum one year of experience with healthcare management information systems.
Minimum one year of experience working with healthcare business processes.
Minimum one year of experience working with healthcare analytics and standard reporting measures.
Minimum two years of experience utilizing project management guidelines and best practice.
Minimum two years of experience analyzing data for the purpose of informing business decisions.
Minimum two years of experience creating industry-standard business requirements and process documentation.
Business Systems Analyst III
Minimum four years of experience, training or coursework.
Minimum three years of experience with healthcare management information systems.
Ability to identify, troubleshoot, and resolve small to large scale, basic to complex business and system issues. Ability to organize work and present results in a professional manner.
Minimum three years of experience working with healthcare business processes.
Minimum three years of experience working with healthcare analytics and standard reporting measures.
Minimum four years of experience utilizing project management standards and functions.
Minimum four years of experience analyzing data for the purpose of informing business decisions.
Minimum four years of experience creating industry-standard business requirements and process documentation.

Five & Done is looking to add a contract position to our team in Dallas, TX.
When our clients want a team that understands their ecosystem, prioritizes user experience, and understands what goes into the successful development and launch of an enterprise application, they call us.
And one of the most crucial roles on that team is the Business Analyst.
This role will be key in gathering requirements, architecting complex processes, identifying improvements, and writing detailed specifications for applications that we develop for Toyota. They will interact with the entire project team and stakeholders, including UX designers, technical architects, partners, development teams, project teams from related applications, and most importantly our client.
We want someone who enjoys problem solving in a fast-moving, small-agency environment but still has the professional experience to work with large clients and a multitude of stakeholders. Our clients often choose us to work alongside major consulting organizations because of our nimble nature and consistent track record.
Responsibilities
Become an expert on the application and the process(es) it supports
Work cross-functionally to compile and communicate key insights, identify improvement opportunities, and offer recommendations to the client
Support Business Analysis efforts, including eliciting, documenting, and analyzing business requirements, processes, and workflows
Translate business requirements into clear and concise functional specifications for technical teams
Assess value and feasibility of new features requested by client
Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Assist in QA and UAT to ensure Five & Done’s quality standards are always met
Participate in and support client meetings and training seminars virtually or in person as needed
Create presentation decks as needed for the business
About You
You have 5-7 years of applicable experience
You are a problem solver, collaborative, love a challenge and dig numbers
You are extremely detail oriented and committed to high quality results
You can effectively communicate ideas in a presentation setting
You enjoy working directly with clients and maintaining client relationships
You have experience working with multiple client contacts and vendor teams
You’re proactive. When you see something that needs to be done, you take it on without thinking twice
You are a stickler for detail and love to get the root cause of issues
You come from a background as a Business Analyst, Developer or Architect – or at very least have experience with those types of roles
You have excellent team building and conflict resolution skills
You have a genuine enthusiasm for the work you do, exude positive energy, and are able to maintain a sense of humor under pressure
A few more things...
This is a contract position based in our Dallas, Texas office
Please don't drop by our office, call or email us directly
No recruiters please

Performance Analyst
Location: On-site in Tampa, FL – Elite Insurance Partners
Salary- $80K - $100K/ year
Elite Insurance Partners (EIP) is a nationally recognized leader in the Medicare and life insurance space, consistently ranked as a Top Workplace and one of the fastest-growing insurance brokerages in the U.S. We’re passionate about helping families protect their future, and we’re looking for a Performance Analyst who can help us protect ours, by monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing the KPIs that drive our success.
This isn’t a “build a report and call it a day” type of role. We’re seeking someone who is curious, forward-thinking, and eager to challenge assumptions. You’ll work cross-functionally with marketing, sales, operations, and leadership to ensure we’re not just hitting targets, we’re exceeding them. If you can spot a lagging indicator before it derails performance and know how to translate complex data into a clean, actionable dashboard, we want to meet you.
What You’ll Do
Monitor organizational performance trends and flag anomalies before they become problems
Analyze operational, financial, and strategic data to measure performance and uncover insights
Develop, maintain, and automate dashboards, scorecards, and KPI trackers in Power BI, Excel, and Salesforce
Use AI tools (ChatGPT, Power BI Copilot, Excel AI) to summarize trends, write reports, and streamline workflows
Enable non-technical users to extract insights through natural language querying and AI copilots
Partner with stakeholders to identify underperforming areas, root causes, and actionable improvements
Deliver clear, concise reporting to leadership — turning complexity into clarity
Build and refine KPI frameworks to ensure alignment with organizational goals
Conduct ad hoc deep dives to support high-stakes strategic decisions
What You Bring
2–4+ years in a performance, business, data, or operations analyst role
Strong experience with Power BI, Salesforce, Excel, SQL, and BI tools
Proven use of AI tools (ChatGPT, Copilot, Python GPT libraries, etc.) to automate analysis or generate insights
Comfortable working with large, messy datasets and turning them into clear, actionable recommendations
Deep understanding of KPIs, business performance metrics, and process optimization
Excellent communication skills, you can explain analytics to non-analytical stakeholders
Bonus Points For
Experience in insurance, call centers, marketing agencies, or high-growth environments
Contributing to or maintaining a data dictionary or KPI glossary
Owning a monthly/quarterly business review (MBR/QBR) process
Migrating reporting from spreadsheets to BI platforms
Python or R skills for deeper statistical analysis
Why Join EIP?
At EIP, our people are our greatest asset. That’s why we invest heavily in your success, both inside and outside the office.

Workforce Analyst, Sr. — Contract Opportunity ($47/hr.)

Contract Length: 6 Months
Pay Rate: $47/hour
About the Role
We’re seeking an experienced Senior Workforce Management Analyst for a 6-month contract assignment. In this role, you’ll play a key part in ensuring staffing levels align with business demand by forecasting needs, managing workforce data, and providing strategic insights to leadership. This position serves as a bridge between multiple departments and helps shape long-term workforce planning.


Key Responsibilities
Manage staffing files and facilitate meetings across various teams.
Serve as the first point of contact for workforce-related inquiries.
Monitor attrition and staffing KPIs; provide recommendations for optimization.
Lead and manage workforce analytics projects and scale best practices across the organization.
Train leaders on workforce management principles and risk mitigation.
Forecast and plan staffing needs up to two years in advance.
Collaborate with Talent Acquisition, Finance, Operations, HR, and other departments to align on strategy and workforce planning.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.

job_title: Cyber Security and Business Cyber Risk Analyst
job_description:
Pileum is an IT Consulting and Systems Integration firm based in Jackson, MS. We are leading-edge innovators, combining industry knowledge, functional experience, and technology skills to help our clients grow and create extraordinary value in their businesses. Our mission is to enhance our clients'' profits through business process improvement, service differentiation, and technology-based solutions. We solve business problems by improving practices and technology, using creativity, objectivity, and analytical methodologies.
Pileum's Security, Risk and Compliance (SRC) team is looking to hire a cybersecurity resource. This job can be based in Jackson, MS, Knoxville, TN, Nashville, TN, Birmingham, AL or the Florida Panhandle. This is a full-time hybrid role for a Senior Security and Business Risk Analyst at Pileum Corporation. The Senior Security and Business Risk Analyst will be responsible for performing day-to-day tasks related to cybersecurity and risk analysis. This includes:
Managing security programs for clients against industry standard RMFs (e.g. NIST CSP, HIPAA, CMMC, etc.)
Performing baseline assessments
Assessing risks with consideration for identified control gaps
Prioritizing mitigation activities based on severity and budget
Establishing and managing the POA&M
Occasional incident response activities primarily as an incident commander, but occasionally helping with containment and analysis work
Other duties as required or assigned
Pileum's SRC services include providing consulting services to clients that vary from assessments and testing to advice on regulatory and third-party requirements to operating as the client's Chief Information Security Officer via our vCISO services program. Our goal is to build a risk-based security program that properly identifies and manages cyber risks to meet internal and external expectations, regulatory requirements, or client expectations.
Qualifications
Ability to lead security programs for various industry verticals.
Must be comfortable providing leadership advice at all business levels
Analytical skills, Risk Analysis, and Data Analysis
Excellent communication skills and ability to clearly articulate complex security risks in terms that are understandable by non-technical leaders
Knowledge of security principles and best practices
Familiarity with risk management frameworks and how to use them to manage cyber risk, including an understanding of security domains and their interdependence
Ability to identify and assess cybersecurity risks
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities
Familiarity with security tools and technologies
Proficient in Word and Excel
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field is a plus
Professional certifications (such as CISSP, CISA, CRISC, Security+) and demonstrated cybersecurity experience will be given preference.

SENIOR FIDUCIARY BUSINESS CONTROLS ANALYST
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?
This position will work directly with the City National Bank's ("CNB") Business Control Officer ("BCO") and Business Control Managers ("BCM"s) for Fiduciary and Wealth Management and will partner with the Risk Framework leadership team. Responsibilities will encompass understanding controls required for compliance with applicable regulations, identification of relevant issues, solution design, design of required controls and monitoring, leveraging industry practices and coordination with colleagues across the organization.This role is expected to contribute constructively and balance challenges, supporting alignment of business objectives with CNB's risk appetite and established limits.
WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Responsible for the support in development and implementation of control-related assessments, programs, development of controls to aid in implementation of regulation, rules, and risk management requirements.
Analyze, evaluate and periodically review relevant risk management practices across the organization, including activities at network affiliates. Collaborate closely with colleagues across the 2nd and 3rd lines to strengthen the control environment and enhance risk management practices.
Analyze and evaluate data that effects the technical, operational, and business functions and provide insight to the practical impacts/implications to the business line.
Provide guidance on Control Standards to ensure compliance-related controls are documented in line with the standards
Participate in execution of essential risk program functions, including Compliance Risk Assessments, Key Risk Indicators (KRI) review, Issue Management, Operational Losses, and more. Provide informed and valuable risk and control perspectives other members of the Business Control team and Business Units.
Coordinate 2LOD Review & Challenge interactions with LOB, engage with 2LOD Compliance Testing (including RBC) to provide sufficient guidance and support during the testing period
Contribute to the development of a robust risk culture, risk conduct, and risk literacy within the first line of defense, including design and implementation of preventive and detective controls relating to Entertainment Banking activities (focus on Compliance-related controls)
Coordinate with 1st LOD Testing team to understand observations related to compliance controls and ensure appropriate actions are documented to remediate gaps
Act as the business teams' liaison for business line risk management, compliance activities, legal engagement, and internal or external audits.
Act as a liaison representing Business Control Office at internal meetings; establishing and cultivating strong working relationships with all stakeholders. Attend meetings with and/or in place of SVP BCO, provide feedback and escalate decision.
Build and sustain effective relationships and alliances both internally and across all lines of business and staff areas to help deliver results and to ensure opportunities are identified, analyzed and managed appropriately. Understand interdependencies to achieve success.
Partner with team members to contribute concise communication materials for senior management. Develop presentations for internal and external meeting that are compelling, concise, and graphical to convey message.
Prioritize organizational risk management objectives.
Participate in special projects as necessary.
Facilitate audit and examination activities.
WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
Minimum 5 years within or related to financial services
Minimum 5 years of auditing, risk, control or finance consulting experience
Minimum 5 years of experience with risk management methodologies
Minimum 3 years of Advanced level experience in Microsoft Office skills, including Word, Excel, Access and PowerPoint
Additional Qualifications
Preferred CRM certification
5 years in a role requiring complex problem solving
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills - and ability to interact with colleagues at all levels in a peer-like way, and achieve goals without direct control over resources
Strong emerging end-to-end generalist problem solving skills, e.g.,
Defining and deconstructing problems
Prioritizing issues and analysis
Structuring and building quantitative and qualitative/conceptual analyses
Knowledge in Financial Services, Project Management
Demonstrated ability to Influence change, build relationships, communicate effectively, work under pressure, manage multiple priorities and deliver high caliber results.
Proficiency with MS Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent time management, organizational, and prioritization skills and ability to balance multiple priorities.
Quick learning ability, outstanding analytical skills and a structured way of thinking, your attention to details is exceptional
Operate well under stress, even faced with tight timelines for ambitious deliverables Significant experience in driving operational change with front line to senior leadership personnel
Excellent relationship and stakeholder management skills
Be able to handle uncertainty well, and are able to simplify complexity

The Accelerated Business Operations Professional (ABOP) is a 24-month intensive rotational program designed to give new team members exposure to multiple departments and levels of executives across the company. Analysts in this program will develop exceptional technical and analytical skills through projects that support operational objectives and maximize company return on investment. In rotations professionals will gain in-depth knowledge of the business unit they are supporting through close collaboration with senior leadership. To supplement analysts' professional development they will be given personal coaching and mentoring by operational leaders throughout their rotation.
The Accelerated Business Operations Professional will be a strong critical thinker and problem-solver capable of delivering detailed and accurate analysis on a wide array of topics relating to call center operations and marketing. They will also demonstrate superior time management and organizational skills to effectively manage implementation of projects and processes.

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.

Opportunity to participate with other business leaders to help solve core business problems

Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office suite especially Excel

Articulate and well-spoken; strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills

Comfortable with heavy senior leadership contact and building relationships across divisional leaders
