Job Purpose
Reporting to the General Manager, the Data Analyst Coordinator is responsible for playing a critical support role in ensuring that the sales, marketing, and operations teams are aligned with up-to-date, actionable insights, organized program tracking and key performance data. This role gathers, organizes, and reports sales, operations, delivery and marketing data in order to leverage and optimize the customer experience to drive growth across the business.
Scope of the Position
This position will work with all teams to coordinate, analyze and report on business outcomes and activities. This position will work cross functionally with all departments to ensure business goals are identified and achieved.
Key Responsibilities:
Under the direction of the General Manager, provide a full range of data and analysis with 100% accuracy:
1. Compile, consolidate and maintain accurate weekly and monthly sales performance reports from CRM, POS and other systems for the management team.
2. Develop, maintain dashboards that assist in tracking and reporting on KPI’s, lead sources, conversion rates, and campaign ROI across platforms such as HubSpot, Podium, Intercom, and Evosus.
3. Prepare data summaries and dashboards for sales meetings, marketing reviews, and executive briefings.
4. Ensure data integrity and identify opportunities for upselling, cross-selling etc.
5. Focus on operational initiatives, including the “Hole in One” delivery and service program.
6. Assist with tracking success/failure cases and compiling reports for bonus eligibility and performance reviews.
7. Work with the Operations and Customer Experience teams to verify documentation and ensure follow-through on qualified cases.
8. Assist marketing to generate campaign performance reports and track customer engagement reports.
9. Provide insights on inventory turnover, stock levels and ordering patterns.
10. Support workforce planning by tracking products and workload.
11. Create cross-departmental collaboration and present findings in a clear and visual manner to ensure insights are communicated to non-technical team members.
12. Builds relationships and problem solve with team members, as required.
13. Monitor and analyze key performance metrics, such as delivery timeliness, warehouse accuracy, and customer satisfaction.
14. Implement systems to reduce damaged stock and delivery callbacks.
15. Ensure any paperwork discrepancies or data entry issues are resolved.
16. Maintain a safe and organized work environment, adhering to all safety regulations and protocols.
17. Other related duties.
Qualifications
Must have a Certificate in Business, Data Analytics, or related field and a minimum of four (4) years related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
1. Demonstrated experience in data analysis and improving processes in a retail environment
2. Demonstrated experience with finding information and creating reports that enhance and support customer service.
3. Must be able to take direction, collaborate with departments, and work independently.
4. Demonstrate problem solving with the ability to ensure accuracy and detail.
5. Must have excellent timely and regular reporting skills.
6. Demonstrated organizational, time management and presentation skills.
7. Ability to use Microsoft Office, Excel and other vital retail management software systems.
8. Familiarity with POS, CRM and digital marketing analystics platforms eg. Hub Spot
9. A valid Nevada driver’s license with a clean DMV record.
Competencies
1. Teamwork and Communication
2. Problem Solving
3. Decisive Insight
4. Self Motivation
Values
1. Data Analysis
2. Customer Satisfaction
3. Effectiveness and Competence
4. Structure

Join Global Partners LP as our Business Intelligence (BI) Manager for the Terminals business unit. Collaborating closely with leadership, terminal operations, and divisional teams, you will champion data-driven decision-making across the organization by designing and deploying timely analytics, defining key performance indicators, and implementing robust business intelligence solutions. Through your expertise in tools like SQL, Tableau, and modern data platforms—including Snowflake, dbt, and Fivetran—you will help ensure that terminal operations are optimized for profitability, efficiency, and growth.
The BI Manager, Terminals at Global Partners is responsible for driving operational insights, improving profitability, and empowering terminal teams with actionable intelligence. You’ll develop dashboards, optimize processes, and provide recommendations on terminal capacity, pricing strategies, scheduling, and asset utilization. Your analysis will directly support decisions related to terminal operations, acquisition strategies, and long-term planning, enabling us to maximize value and operational performance.
The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in modern BI tools and analytics stacks, and a deep understanding of operational data workflows. They will play a crucial role in driving business growth and improving operational efficiency through data-driven recommendations.
For over 90 years Global Partners LP has been delivering the energy our communities need to grow, move, and thrive. From Alltown Fresh, with its innovative chef-led creations and guest-focused retail experience, to our vast network of over 50 liquid energy terminals across the eastern seaboard and beyond, Global Partner’s integrated network of businesses delivers value day-in and day-out to our guests and customers across the US. At Global Partners we embrace the future, investing in energy transition with initiatives like GlobalGLO and supporting the communities in which we operate with our charitable work.

We’re excited for the next 90 years at Global Partners and what innovative new ideas we can bring to our guests and customers in the future. We’re looking for passionate people with great ideas to contribute to our company’s future. If you’re motivated by what’s next, Global Partners can provide you with the opportunities to push your career to the next level.

The Types of “Energy” You Bring
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
You are self-motivated and like to take initiative.
You are a team player with a positive attitude.
You have strong time management skills.
“Gauges” of Responsibility
Lead and mentor (player coach) a team of BI analysts, fostering analytical rigor, technical skill development, with a culture of curiosity and data-driven insights.
Partner with Terminal leadership to define key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop robust analytical frameworks to measure business performance, identify trends, and track progress against strategic goals.
Translate ambiguous business questions into specific, testable hypotheses and analytical plans; proactively identify areas where data analysis can deliver significant value.
Lead the end-to-end development, delivery, and optimization of BI solutions, including dashboards and reports, utilizing SQL and BI platforms (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Communicate complex analytical findings and strategic recommendations clearly and concisely to diverse audiences, including senior leadership, through compelling data storytelling and visualizations.
Conduct deep-dive analyses using SQL, BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.), and Python/R to uncover root causes, identify actionable opportunities for growth or optimization, and quantify business impact.
Own the design, development, and continuous improvement of core Terminal dashboards and reporting suites, ensuring data accuracy, clarity, and relevance for various Retail business verticals.
Champion data literacy, drive adoption of self-service BI tools, and promote best practices in data governance within the Terminal unit.
Collaborate with central data teams to influence the design and evolution of data models and infrastructure needed to support robust Terminal analytics and data capabilities.
Explore and apply appropriate statistical techniques or basic forecasting models to address specific Terminal challenges, such as customer behavior analysis or demand planning (nice-to-have).
Champion data quality, consistency, and governance best practices within the Terminal analytics domain.

“Fuel” for You
Coins! We offer competitive salaries and opportunities for growth. We mean it! We have an amazing Talent Development Team who create trainings for growth and job development.
Health + Wellness - Medical, Dental, Visions and Life Insurance. Along with additional wellness support.
The Road Ahead – We offer 401k and a match component!
Professional Development - We provide tuition reimbursement; this benefit is offered after 6 months of service.
Give Back! We believe in community support. We know everyone gives in their own way, that’s why we offer paid volunteer time-off to you to help an organization of your choice.
The GPS of our Interview Process
First thing first, if you’re interested in the role, please apply.
A talent acquisition team member will review your resume in partnership with the hiring manager. If your experience would lend to this opportunity a recruiter will contact you.
We conduct “in-person” (Teams) interviews and provide additional interview information or other items needed at that time.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree required
5-7+ years in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics, demonstrating progressive responsibility.
2-3+ years of experience leading projects or directly managing/mentoring analytical staff.
Proven experience translating business needs into analytical solutions and actionable insights within a business context. Experience within the Terminals or related industries.
Expert-level SQL skills for complex data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Deep expertise with major BI platforms (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, etc.) including dashboard design, development, and performance optimization.
Exceptional data storytelling and communication skills, able to present complex information clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences.
Strong leadership, mentoring, and collaboration skills; proven ability to manage and develop analysts as a player-coach.
Excellent business acumen and problem-solving skills, particularly within a Terminal context.
Exposure to data preparation/modeling tools (e.g., dbt, sqlmesh).
Exposure to Python or R for data analysis and automation.
Experience with statistical analysis, forecasting techniques, or basic predictive modeling.
Familiarity with cloud data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery).
Passion for data quality, continuous learning, and fostering a data-informed culture.
We value passion and potential. If you are enthusiastic about a position and think you can make a meaningful impact, we encourage you to apply even if you don't check every box. We embrace different perspectives, backgrounds and experiences.

job_title: IT ERP Accounting Business Analyst (Consultant) - 2 Year Duration
job_description:
Description

Trinidad Benham Corporation is seeking an IT ERP Accounting Business Analyst (Consultant) with direct experience in Accounting functions and 3+ years of relevant Business Analyst experience to support the implementation of core Accounting functions in our new manufacturing ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system. In this role, you will play a key part in bridging the gap between our Accounting department and the IT team, ensuring that technology solutions align with business goals. You will lead requirements gathering, process analysis, and solution design, while actively collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, scalable IT solutions. This is an exciting opportunity that combines the world of accountant and business analyst to help drive business success. This position will be an opportunity for a candidate to take ownership of complex areas of our application development and implementation in an agile team of Product Owners and Business Analysts.

Key Responsibilities

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.
Subject Matter Expertise
Strong knowledge and expertise in various business areas and ERP related topics to advocate for correct implementations and best practices
Expertise/experience in one or more of the following Accounting focused ERP modules is required: Accounts Payables, Accounts Receivables, Manufacturing / Inventory, General Ledger
Strong knowledge of accounting principles in order support development of processes that ensure compliance with controls and financial reporting standards
Requirements Definition
Engage with Accounting team to define Accounting and business needs/requirements within the company’s ERP application
Lead requirements gathering process in assigned areas, focused on Accounting features of our ERP application.
Shape and prioritize backlog, utilizing business expertise and understanding of customer needs, and translate requirements into user stories & acceptance criteria
Balance business value with technical feasibility while prioritizing stories and features, optimizing cost, and improving delivery efficiency. Always be an advocate for the solution with the highest ROI.
Act as the "voice of the customer" within the IT team to ensure the team "builds the right thing"
Document and communicate requirements to ensure the IT team is engaged and requirements are understood
Solution Design
Lead in the overall translation of business requirements into technical solutions
Lead how requirements may be implemented from a functional standpoint and drive/improve user experience
Drive creation and selection of solution options, work with the team leads (development, architecture/data, business analysis) to assess tech elements of the solution prior to implementation and user testing
Identify business needs related to solutions requiring integration and configuration options as well as understand application landscape to ensure solution meets organizational needs
Lead the design based on business needs and our overall vision for the application
Product Delivery
Facilitate agile project management principles (sprint planning, release planning, user story creation) to ensure the product is built efficiently and effectively
Facilitate demos and user acceptance testing to user groups of the product you have created
Accountable to manage the implementation and testing with the development team to ensure the end-to-end build of a particular part of a solution is compliant and works as designed
Ensures the backlog is healthy : Stays 2-3 sprints ahead and ensures each feature has a clear definition of “done”; ensures each feature level deliverable is aligned to a definition of readiness to enter sprint

The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of core Accounting ERP systems, a strategic mindset for identifying enhancements, and the ability to collaborate effectively with developers and stakeholders
Collaborate with the Product Owner and Business Analyst (BA) team to produce creative and functional design solutions
This candidate should aim to become a subject matter expert within the Business Analyst team in accounting features of our ERP application.
Work with UI/UX design team to create functional design solutions
Produce requirements and users stories to develop new areas of the application
Perform QA/testing on implementations that you were directly involved in designing to ensure features have been developed as intended

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

Bachelor's degree in Accounting or a related field, direct experience in Accounting functions, and 3+ years of experience as a Product Owner, IT Business Analyst, or similar role in ERP core accounting systems management
CPA or CMA desired
Strong understanding of ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle, Microsoft Dynamics) and their application in business processes along with strong working knowledge of ERP Financials modules
Experience implementing one or more of the following Accounting focused ERP modules: Accounts Payables, Accounts Receivables, Manufacturing / Inventory, General Ledger.
Hands-on experience supporting the month-end close process, reconciliations, and audit/compliance requirements in ERP environments
Experience in a manufacturing industry of food or food contact products is desired
Excellent project management skills, with experience in leading projects and meeting deadlines
Experience with Agile methodology and strong understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle Management model and documentation.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to manage multiple priorities.

Benefits

Employee-owned
Advancement Opportunities
Insurance coverage that includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance and flexible spending accounts
401(k) with employer match
Paid holidays and competitive vacation/sick pay plans
Tuition assistance program

About Trinidad Benham
We are a 100% employee-owned company offering an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP). Trinidad Benham cares about you beyond a paycheck and a benefits package. We are culture of teamwork, creativity, pride, and ownership. Everyone at Trinidad Benham strives cohesively to offer exceptional products and service because we know our efforts result in a healthy bottom line and a thriving ESOP. We are planting the seeds for a more sustainable tomorrow. Become an owner today!

Trinidad Benham Corporation is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer that participates in the E-Verify program as required by law. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status or other legally protected characteristics.

Business Systems Analyst for D365
Incident Management Support and Small Enhancements
Job Summary
As a Business Systems Analyst for D365, you will be responsible for providing incident management support and implementing small enhancements for the Microsoft Dynamics 365 platform. You will work closely with business users and IT teams to troubleshoot, resolve, and prevent issues that affect the functionality and performance of the D365 applications, as well as develop and implement minor system improvements. You will also document incidents, root causes, and solutions, while offering recommendations for platform enhancements and best practices.
Job Responsibilities
Analyze, diagnose, and resolve incidents related to the D365 platform
Coordinate with the business users, and IT teams, to ensure timely and effective resolution of incidents and small enhancements, minimizing the impact on the business operations.
Monitor and report on the incident management metrics, such as incident volume, severity, resolution time, and customer satisfaction.
Document the incident details, root causes, and solutions, and maintain the incident management database and knowledge base.
Provide incident management support for the D365 platform enhancements, upgrades, and migrations.
Identify and implement preventive measures and best practices to reduce the occurrence and severity of incidents.
Provide training and guidance to the business users and IT teams on the D365 platform functionality and incident management processes.
Provide comprehensive support throughout the project lifecycle, from requirements gathering and documentation to testing, deployment, and post-implementation evaluation.
Job Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field.
7+ years of experience in business systems analysis, incident management, or related role.
Strong knowledge and experience with the Dynamics 365 platform, including Finance and Operations, Customer Engagement, and Power Platform.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and customer service skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Ability to work under pressure and prioritize tasks.
Certification in Dynamics 365 or ITIL is a plus.

As our Data Analyst, you will be responsible for turning raw data into clear, actionable, and decision-driving visuals that help team members quickly understand what’s working, what’s not, and what needs attention. What you'll do at Crew:
Bring a storytelling lens to data, helping our team understand what’s happening, why it matters, and what action to take.
Own and evolve our BI tools (primarily Sisense), making it simple, engaging, and intuitive.
Analyze performance and operational data to uncover trends, gaps, and opportunities, delivering clear and prescriptive recommendations.
Regularly collaborate cross-functionally to support company initiatives.
Meet regularly with data users to gather feedback, drive continuous improvement, and promote data literacy across the organization.
Design and automate dashboards and alerts with a "less is more" approach, making key metrics easy to access and act on.
Automate recurring reports and develop alerting systems to proactively notify teams of key shifts, anomalies, and opportunities.
Explore and test emerging tools, including AI-powered analytics and conversational solutions.
Present findings in a clear, actionable, and engaging way.
Balance multiple priorities effectively and communicate trade-offs clearly to align stakeholders and manage expectations.
Crew's Requirements:
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst, BI Visualization or similar
Strong hands-on experience with Sisense, SQL, and Snowflake (or similar platforms)
Skilled in data visualization and dashboard design, especially for non-technical end users
Experience turning data into clear, actionable insights (not just charts and tables)
Curious mindset that asks why, challenges assumptions, and looks for better ways
Excellent time and priority management; able to push back and set boundaries when needed
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Comfortable presenting to senior leaders and field teams alike
Excited about AI tools and emerging technologies, with a willingness to learn, test, and adapt
Familiarity with tools like ServiceNow, Coupa, Dayforce, SiteWatch POS, and Rinsed CRM is a plus
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Data Analytics, Statistics, Business, Computer Science, etc.)

Senior Healthcare Data Analyst / Scientist
Risk Strategies Consulting (RSC) is looking for an expert who can support our clients’ healthcare initiatives through data-driven analytics solutioning and emerging data science methods.
To be successful in this role, you should not only possess strong mathematics capabilities and an analytical mindset, but also be able to effectively communicate strategy, methodologies, and data-oriented results to both internally and external key stakeholders. The candidate must have a proactive approach to work, a problem-solving aptitude, and a willingness to learn and adapt to emerging industry practices. The candidate will be motivated, well-organized, and a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment. Your innovative work will directly impact our clients’ financial strategies and decisions.
Core Characteristics
Achievement-oriented – Enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail.
Innovative – Prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity with multivariable inputs and uncertainties.
Resource maximizing – Identifies and leverages team resource strengths, while maintaining awareness and pushing for needed growth opportunities.
Autonomous/ independent – Enjoys working with little direction.
Dynamically detail oriented – Has the awareness of the need and ability to go deep without getting lost, while staying grounded with the bigger picture.
Critical thinker – Applies logic, reason, and rationale to a given problem and/ or proposed solution.
Dependable – More reliable than spontaneous.
Flexible – Ability to manage competing priorities in a fluid environment.
Prioritizing – Effective with prioritization, goal setting, and time management.
Communicator – Excellent in communications, interpersonally, and in writing.
Responsibilities
Analyze complex healthcare data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Create and present reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Isolate healthcare trend drivers and financial impacts associated with client medical claims, pharmacy claims, and other types of healthcare data.
Perform varying types of analysis including medical carrier network valuations, discount analysis, and benchmarking.
Leverage real-world, statistical data and modeling to recommend, test, validate, and track supporting health economics, return on investment (ROI), and healthcare benefit models for client businesses beyond traditional methods.
Develop analytical analytics, data models, reporting, and data mining tools that scale across clients.
Codevelop and implement data collection strategies, design, and maintain databases.
Conduct complex analyses adhering to best practice standards by selecting appropriate data sources, developing assumptions, recognizing considerations, and establishing recommendations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency through data analysis.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.
Resolve unreasonable results, suboptimal solutions, and data anomalies based on experience and professional judgment.
Act as a technical expert and advise on strategic data mining techniques used to identify new relationships or patterns in data.
Consult and provide expertise on new or enhanced product development opportunities including discussions on methodology, data requirements, coding implications, and the viability and profitability of a given proposal.
Build predictive models to accurately analyze potential outcomes that are likely costs / savings for a given initiative or event(s).
Develop and maintain effective cross-functional working relationships to assure accurate, timely teamwork and project execution with assigned teams.
Translate, document, and present approaches, processes, and results of complex modeling and statistical analysis into layperson terms for diverse, internal and external audiences.
Build and maintain client relationships.
Monitor market trends, engage in market research, and identify opportunities for initiatives.
Support the development and training of team members and colleagues.
Qualifications
Required:
Bachelor’s degree (BS) in Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Statistics or Computer Science.
7+ years’ working experience as an Actuarial Analyst, Data Analyst, or Data Scientist in the HealthCare sector.
5+ years of hands-on experience with structured query languages and statistical computing (e.g., R, RStudio, SQL, Python, SAS).
3+ years of hands-on experience building and conducting ETL tasks.
Experience with analytical analysis using Machine Learning techniques.
Expert with data mining and visualization tools such as Qlik, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience with developing medical and pharmacy utilization reporting, establishing utilization trends, and identifying meaningful and actionable observations.
Experience with underwriting insurance premiums is a plus.
Must possess strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to generate information quickly and manage multiple projects at once.
Knowledge of insurance legislation, conducting health statistical modeling for medical and pharmacy, ROI analyses, and indirect comparisons and also hands on expertise with respect to newer and non-traditional data science approaches.
Diverse experience of healthcare databases and data sources (claims, encounters, labs, EMR etc.).
Extensive knowledge of healthcare/medical economics data such as hospital/physician /ASC claims, utilization data, and healthcare industry coding systems ICD-10, CPT/HCPCS, Revenue Codes, MS/APR-DRGs and APC.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, conceptualize, problem solve, and disseminate information confidently and collaboratively with attention to detail, accuracy, timeliness.
Solid knowledge of business, financial, strategic concepts, and emerging trends.
Solid interpersonal skills, oral and written, and a professional presence.

At NorthBay Health, the Epic Business Intelligence Analyst will work with the Enterprise Information Management Team, Epic Applications’ teams and internal customers to provide a service oriented, cross-functional, knowledgeable, single point of technical leadership to support Epic Cogito data and reporting needs.

Collaborate with data architects and BI developers to build robust data models that support self-service analytics and reporting needs.
Develop documentation for data workflows, mappings, and data dictionaries.
Participate in cross-functional projects involving clinical and operational data analysis.
Monitor data pipeline integrity and proactively address data quality issues.

Epic certification will ultimately be required in this position
Experience:
Three (3)+ years of experience as a data engineer or similar role, with at least 2 years working with Epic EMR data.
Strong expertise with Epic Cogito tools (e.g., Clarity, Caboodle, Radar, SlicerDicer).
Proficient in SQL, ETL development, and data warehousing concepts.
Experience working with Epic Clarity Data Models and an understanding of healthcare domains (clinical, operational, revenue cycle).

About Us
At NorthBay Health, we are guided by our values: Nurturing Care; Own It; Respect; Build Trust; and Hardwire Excellence. These principles lead us to our TRUE NORTH and inspire us to provide exceptional care.
These values serve as the foundation of everything we do, guiding us to deliver individualized care with integrity and accountability. We are committed to fostering a culture of collaboration, where every team member is valued and empowered to contribute their best to the health and well-being of those we serve.
NorthBay Health was born in Solano County and we remain committed to delivering advanced medicine here to the community we serve. That’s why we continue to invest in modernizing and expanding our facilities, purchasing cutting-edge equipment and pushing the limits of technology alongside other healthcare pioneers, such as the Mayo Clinic. Our competence, capabilities and practice of collaborating with some of the nation’s most advanced clinical institutions enable us to manage extremely complex cases right here.
Join us with our commitment to excellence, to achieve our vision to be the trusted healthcare partner of choice for the communities we serve.

Position Summary
Carey International is seeking a Technical Business Analyst to support the design, execution, and optimization of technology-enabled business processes across the enterprise. This role sits at the intersection of business operations, data, and technology — ensuring that systems, integrations, and insights drive measurable operational improvements and customer value.
The Technical Business Analyst will analyze workflows, translate business requirements into technical specifications, and deliver actionable data solutions through integration, reporting, and business intelligence. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, analytical, and technically proficient, with experience in process mapping, data analysis, and execution within enterprise systems.
This position plays a critical role in Carey’s digital transformation — helping modernize workflows, unify data, and build scalable, data-driven systems that enhance decision-making and efficiency.
Principal Duties, Responsibilities, and Expectations
Business & Process Analysis
Analyze and document current-state business processes across multiple departments, identifying inefficiencies, gaps, and opportunities for automation.
Translate business needs into functional and technical requirements for system enhancements and new integrations.
Develop future-state process maps, technical documentation, and workflow diagrams to guide implementation.
Support process improvement initiatives from analysis through post-implementation validation, ensuring measurable ROI and scalability.
Execution & Integration
Partner with IT, engineering, and vendor teams to design and execute system integrations across Carey’s operational, CRM, and financial platforms.
Define data interfaces, APIs, and workflow logic to ensure seamless system interoperability.
Participate in testing, user acceptance (UAT), and post-launch reviews to ensure requirements are met and performance is optimized.
Support migration of data and workflows from legacy systems to modern, cloud-based platforms.
Ensure all integrations align with Carey’s data governance, compliance, and cybersecurity frameworks.
Data Mining, Reporting & Business Intelligence
Build and maintain dashboards and reports that provide real-time visibility into operational, financial, and customer performance.
Perform data mining and analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and improvement opportunities across business functions.
Collaborate with Data Engineering and BI teams to create and maintain data models, KPIs, and performance metrics.
Develop SQL queries, scripts, and visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Enable self-service reporting capabilities for business teams and ensure accuracy, timeliness, and consistency of data outputs.
Support the establishment of a centralized data warehouse and ensure smooth ETL data flows across systems.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement
Partner with department heads, product managers, and data teams to gather requirements, validate use cases, and align on execution priorities.
Facilitate workshops and design sessions to define business problems and co-develop technical solutions.
Communicate technical concepts clearly to non-technical audiences, ensuring alignment between business goals and system capabilities.
Support change management and training efforts related to new processes, dashboards, or systems.
Continuous Improvement & Governance
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the impact of process and system enhancements.
Recommend ongoing optimizations to data pipelines, integrations, and analytics workflows based on usage and feedback.
Ensure documentation, reports, and dashboards meet Carey’s governance and audit standards.
Maintain detailed change logs, process documentation, and technical specifications for all implemented solutions.
Job Qualifications
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Business Administration, Computer Science, or Data Analytics required.
Advanced certification in Business Analysis (CBAP), Lean Six Sigma, or Data Analytics preferred.
Experience
4–6 years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or Systems Analyst in a technology-driven organization.
Demonstrated experience with data analysis, reporting, BI tools, and system integrations.
Proficiency in SQL and strong familiarity with data structures, relational databases, and APIs.
Experience working with ETL tools, data warehouses, and process automation platforms (e.g., UiPath, n8n, Zapier).
Hands-on experience with business intelligence platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Experience with process mapping tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart, Bizagi) and workflow documentation.
Skills & Competencies
Analytical Thinking: Strong data analysis, problem-solving, and process modeling skills.
Technical Acumen: Understanding of databases, data architecture, APIs, and BI ecosystems.
Communication: Skilled at translating business needs into technical requirements and communicating clearly across technical and business audiences.
Execution Focus: Proven ability to move projects from concept to delivery with measurable business results.
Data Visualization: Ability to build intuitive dashboards and performance reports for senior management.
Project Management: Experience working in Agile or hybrid environments, balancing multiple initiatives and deadlines.
Change Enablement: Comfortable supporting adoption of new tools, data systems, and workflows.
Attributes
Curious, detail-oriented, and data-driven.
Proactive in identifying opportunities for improvement and automation.
Highly organized, with strong documentation discipline.
Adaptable and collaborative, comfortable working across technical and non-technical teams.
Committed to operational excellence and continuous learning.
General Working Conditions:
The office-working environment is generally favorable.
Standard office equipment is available.
May require extended workdays to meet project demands.
Physical Requirements:
Must work in the office.
While in the office, work is generally sedentary but may require standing and walking up to 20% of the time.
Constant use of computers for keying and reading screens.

SUMMARY: Under minimal supervision, responsible for developing, maintaining, and providing consolidated financial reporting and analysis for all CLS entities. Responsible for determining the reason behind financial statement trends or changes in historical or current results. Regularly liaises with financial leaders of all entities within CLS to both obtain and provide information as necessary. Provides guidance on how to set up certain items within accounting systems in order to maintain reporting and data quality and leads special projects that require complex financial analysis.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include but are not limited to:
Consolidate monthly financial statements in a timely and accurate manner; prepare schedules for monthly financial packet and internal reporting purposes.
Creates and maintains financial forecast model based on operational metrics and key assumptions.
Provide analysis into financial statement trends; work with reporting entities on discrepancies.
Develops annual financial budget model for all CLS entities. Analyzes balance sheet account trends to ensure accurate forecasting and updates models if necessary.
Integrate acquired entities into CLS financial reporting upon the completion of an acquisition.
Support for the monthly financial reporting package distributed to Board. Package contains all financials, KPI’s, budget vs actuals, and various other metrics.
Prior to finalizing close, review detailed analysis files to determine if there are any anomalies that need to be explained or items that need to be reclassed in order to maintain consistent month to month financials. Completes analysis on any variances as necessary.
Leverage ERP systems and current tools to drive automation and efficiency into financial consolidations. Evaluate new software if relevant.
Reviews and/or completes bank compliance documents and analysis including but not limited to quarterly covenant, quarterly backlog, quarterly financials, and monthly borrowing base. Other items such as excess cash flow calculation and any other documents and communication with bank required as needed.
Maintains detailed tracking of all monthly EBITDA adjustments.
Works on complex analysis projects within the Accounting department as needed.
Provides guidance to Accounting teams on how to account for certain items based on knowledge of accounting systems and reporting needs to ensure reports and data are consistent and correct.
Support all financial audit and tax requests as needed.
Completes occasional data quality checks within Deltek to ensure reporting is accurate.
Creates ad-hoc reports or analysis based upon any requests from CFO, management, or the Board.
Maintains complete discretion with confidential matters.
Performs other related duties as required.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: N/A
ACCOUNTABILITY: This position is responsible for working with all office staff, ensuring a healthy work environment and the satisfaction of all staff, both corporate and project. Must be able to work effectively and professionally with internal and external customers, including Board members, clients, applicants, vendors and others.
QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS (minimum and preferred requirements): To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Requires a minimum of a Bachelor’s (B.A.) degree in finance, business, economics, or related analytical field from four-year college or university. Minimum 5 years of related experience required. Some supervisory experience preferred but not required. CPA Preferred.
Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices as well as the analysis and reporting of financial data. Balanced combination of strong financial skills, attention to detail, dedication to client service, and effective time management a necessity.

IT Business Systems Analyst II
**

DESCRIPTIONApplying analytical techniques and processes, the IT Business Systems Analyst II provides guidance to IT and Business Departments, to resolve technical and project implementation deliverables for medium and complex projects. The IT Business Systems Analyst II is responsible for developing system documentation such as requirements specifications, design documents, process flows, use cases, system Integration flows, data flows, project plans, user manuals, and training procedures. The IT Business Systems Analyst II understands business requirements and often serves as a liaison among stakeholders in order to understand the structure, policies, and operations of an organization, and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.
Requirements include (but are not limited to):
Business Analysis Planning & Monitoring
Elicitation & Collaboration
Requirements Life Cycle Management
Strategy Analysis
Requirements Analysis
Data Analysis
Solution Evaluation
REQUIREMENTS
Requires five plus (5+) years of relevant technical systems analyst or business work experience
Experience developing Business Requirements - project initiation document, what the needed achievements will be, and the quality measures
Experience developing Functional requirements - describe what the system, process, or product/service must do in order to fulfill the business requirements
Experience developing User (stakeholder) requirements - are a very important part of the deliverables, the needs of the stakeholders will have to be correctly interpreted
Experience developing Quality-of-service (non-functional) requirements - are requirements that do not perform a specific function for the business requirement but are needed to support the functionality. For example: performance, scalability, quality of service (QoS), security and usability
Experience developing Performance Report - define the purpose of a report, its justification, attributes and columns, owners, and runtime parameters
Experience developing Requirements Traceability Matrix - a cross matrix for recording the requirements through each stage of the requirements gathering process
Experience conducting facilitated workshops for requirements analysis
Experience creating workflows and developing graphic representations of complex business processes
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Healthcare, or related program from an accredited institution required
IIBA, CBAP Preferred

Must have a valid California Driver's License
Understanding of SDLC and various methodologies
Knowledge of formal requirements gathering methodologies.
Knowledge of project management principles and practices
Understanding of how to interpret needs of stakeholders correctly
Requires technical, analytical, and process skills
Requires interpersonal skills
Proficiency with Microsoft PC desktop applications including Excel, Word, MS Project, and Visio
Clearly articulate both problems and proposed solutions
Prioritize personal and team workloads to best meet organizational objectives
Work effectively on a high-performing team
Adapt in a dynamic environment through maintaining resiliency
Present issues and challenges to leads and managers
Work with a team of professionals from various disciplines
Makes necessary adjustments to work shift ensure completion of projects and to meet deadlines, e.g., system releases, critical milestones

We are seeking highly motivated, analytical, and detail-oriented individuals to join our growing team. Whether your expertise lies in Financial Analytics or Business Analytics, you will play a key role in turning data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making and business growth.
Both roles require a strong analytical mindset, problem-solving skills, and the ability to communicate complex information clearly to management and stakeholders. While they share common skills in data analysis, reporting, and strategy, each role offers unique responsibilities and growth opportunities.
Job Summary:
Financial Analytics: Focuses on financial data, market trends, and performance metrics to support budgeting, forecasting, investment decisions, and financial reporting.
Business Analytics: Focuses on business operations, digital tools, and AI-powered solutions to streamline workflows, optimize systems, and drive operational efficiency.
Key Responsibilities:
Common Responsibilities (Both Roles):
Analyze data and performance metrics to provide actionable insights and recommendations.
Develop reports, dashboards, and presentations for management and stakeholders.
Support strategic initiatives and decision-making through data-driven insights.
Financial Analytics (Specific):
Analyze financial statements, budgets, forecasts, and variances.
Conduct profitability and cost analysis to improve efficiency.
Support investment evaluations and risk assessments.
Stay updated on industry and regulatory factors that impact financial performance.
Business Analytics (Specific)
Conduct data analytics on social media, campaigns, and operations.
Research and integrate AI tools to automate processes and enhance workflows.
Maintain and optimize information systems to reduce bottlenecks.
Track KPIs and recommend operational improvements.
Qualifications:
Basic (Both Roles)
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business or a related field.
Relevant work experience in data analysis, business operations, or financial analysis.
Preferred:
Professional experience in supervisory or leadership roles.
Financial Analytics: Strong proficiency in financial modeling, Excel, and data visualization tools.
Business Analytics: Hands-on experience with digital/AI tools, systems management, and business process improvement.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Compensation:
The starting salary for this full-time role ranges from $30,000 to $40,000 annually, depending on experience and qualifications. Compensation is competitive and aligned with California’s minimum wage standards, with opportunities for growth based on performance and contribution.
Note: We are open to candidates with OPT/CPT and are open for sponsorship as well.

ERP Business Analyst
SO HERE’S THE DEAL…
We’re not a regular tech company, we’re a “cool” tech company and we do things our way. You may be accustomed to tech companies that work with their “heads down” and give you a small piece of the big picture to “own” but at Northlake Partners (NLP) working as a team and taking ownership are in our DNA – or rather, in our core values (they’re literally two of our four core values). So, to us, being collaborative and supporting each other is more important than throwing on some headphones, keeping to yourself and grinding out your work all alone – although to be fully transparent, that does happen from time to time. To us, “owning” a small piece of the big picture doesn’t really allow you to take ownership if you don’t have the big picture to see where your piece fits in and how it can be improved. So instead, we want everyone to know where we’re going, why we’re going there and to own their part in making it happen. We are a remote company but that doesn’t stop us from being engaged with one another and working as a team. If you believe people should be enriched at work and you love to serve people, you’re our kind of people – so keep reading!
CONSIDER YOURSELF WARNED…
This job is going to be hard. We’re a small company that works on big projects, which means a lot of opportunity to learn (yay!) but it also means it never gets boring, so you need to be committed to the cause and believe what we believe (re: last sentence in section above). The team members that are the most successful here are the ones that enjoy being in the trenches and fighting their way out, facing problems head on and figuring out the best solution. The most successful team members are the ones who are vocal and unafraid to speak up when they have an idea or opinion but are humble enough to recognize when someone else’s idea or opinion is better and will commit themselves to following through with the best idea no matter who or where it came from. They’re the “doers” that are driven, self-motivated, resourceful, curious, constantly seeking new knowledge and want to succeed and grow. But that’s not all! They’re also the ones who play well with others and are communicative, dependable, honest and perceptive of others.
No day will be the same because our “jobs” change daily. But don’t worry, you’ll know what will be expected of you. In fact, you can know right now if you keep reading!
WHAT WE’LL EXPECT OF YOU…
A DAY IN THE LIFE OF AN ERP BUSINESS ANALYST
Most of your time each day will be spent interacting with customers by helping them use the software more effectively, working on implementation tasks, and troubleshooting issues.
In a typical week, you will work closely with our:
Implementation Team to help train, support, and implement NorthScope software.
Development team to escalate software bugs or areas of the software we can improve.
Product Manager to ensure customer requests are added to the development roadmap.
Customers and Implementation team to perform SQL Traces, software upgrades and other general maintenance.
Not every help request comes with perfect information, so this role requires you to be able to think like a business analyst when information is not complete. Someone will excel in this role if they are the type that likes to take on a messy problem from a customer with minimal information and return it solved in a clear and concise manner and enjoys this while working both alone and part of a team.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Learn how to configure and train on the NorthScope software.
Manage and maintain project management tasks for ongoing implementations.
Take direction from the Implementation Manager on what to work on and how to be a highly contributing member of the team.
Learn the basic functionality of Microsoft SQL Server and related tools.
Provide excellent customer service to our customers by quickly and accurately resolving their support requests.
Update support tickets in JIRA, assign them, prioritize, and keep track of their progress.
Communicate with customers and project leads while they have open issues.
Troubleshoot system issues and resolve them.
Document any discovered software bugs.
Other duties as assigned.
EXPERIENCE & SKILLS YOU MUST HAVE
This is a comprehensive list of all the potential areas you will be exposed to. Applicants are expected to have familiarity with everything on the list and work experience with MOST of them.
ERP and/or accounting systems for medium-to-large-scale businesses.
Financial reconciliation experience including an understanding of sub-ledger and general ledger interaction.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to translate support issues into solutions.
Proven relationship building and interpersonal skills to effectively work within our team.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with a high level of initiative and responsibility.
Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated effectiveness working in a team environment.
Strong Excel experience.
Ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines.
Enjoy working in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team environment.
AA or BA/BS in Business, MIS, Computer Science, or equivalent combination of education + experience
OTHER NICE TO HAVE SKILLS
Microsoft SQL Server.
Experience with Jira.
Experience with accounting software.
Work or educational background in tax preparation, financial report reading and analysis.
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT OF US…
Our mission is to build better software so you can build a better business and the “you” refers to both our customers and our team members.
For our customers, this means that as a team we provide ERP software (it’s called NorthScope) and step-by-step guidance, giving them the tools to build the business they’ve always wanted. We take away their pain points by listening to their problems and coming up with the best, most efficient, long-term solutions. Our mission isn’t to simply snag the next deal, it’s to help our customers succeed and to be the best vendor they work with. We always exceed their expectations while providing them the best software solutions that make them more efficient.
As a company, we don’t hire “employees,” we hire team members that think and act like independent business owners. We invest in this mindset by providing training, tools and the opportunity for growth and success. We empower team members and expect everyone to have a voice, even if what they have to say is outside the “parameters” of their job title. We believe the best way to grow our company is to simultaneously grow each team member’s individual “business,” making this a dynamic place to work.
And each day, we live out our mission through our core values:
We work as a team: Our job titles aren’t there to keep us in “lanes” but to highlight the individual skillsets that make up our team. We’re a team working towards the same goal, so we win together or lose together. Everyone’s contribution is vital, so we don’t let the team down or expect others to pick up our slack. When someone’s struggling, we help them and don’t worry about who gets the credit. We don’t tolerate anything that damages our team including poor work results, gossip and negativity.
We serve our customers: We exist to make our customers’ lives better and this starts with building great software. Our software is the tool our customers spend their entire workday using, so making this better directly impacts their ability to perform their jobs happily, successfully, and efficiently. However, we don’t stop at software. If it’s within our ability, we do whatever is necessary to serve our customers and make their lives better.
We take ownership: This isn’t just a “J-O-B” – we all work like we own the place. As owners, we’re not just focused on what we deliver but on how we conduct ourselves, the level of personal accountability, and how we represent the company. We’re here to serve our customers, contribute to the team, and exceed expectations, not simply to occupy a seat. This means we take pride in our work and hold ourselves accountable so we’re here when scheduled, we don’t miss deadlines, and we’re always looking for ways to improve.
We exceed expectations: Everything we do matters to someone so we always aim for excellence, no matter how small or insignificant a task may seem. Our work is high quality and delivered correctly, the first time. We constantly challenge ourselves and other team members to improve and become better versions of ourselves. Our team members are honest, ethical and of high character and we honor commitments and treat others with respect.
Oh, you can also expect us to provide competitive pay and benefits. We anticipate the annual compensation to be anywhere from $85 to $1055k annually, made up of a base salary plus bonuses.
Don’t worry, we won’t stop you there – if you want to earn above average pay you have to be above average.), generous PTO, paid holidays, 40-hour weeks, a challenging workplace, medical, dental and vision, short-term and long-term disability, 401k with employer match, profit sharing and opportunities for growth. This is a remote position; however NLP is located in the Seattle area and we do meet up from time to time so we are only looking for a local candidate.
Applications will only be considered at https://thenlp.com/join-our-team/erp-business-analyst/

About CWC
Continental Western Corporation (CWC) is a national industrial packaging and supply company with over 70 years of experience serving distributors and manufacturers across North America. With a robust catalog of packaging, cordage, and safety products and a commitment to operational excellence, CWC is investing heavily in data-driven strategies to support scalable growth across our 10 U.S. distribution centers.
Why Join CWC?
At CWC, we believe that better data builds better decisions. As we continue to modernize our systems and expand our reach, your work will directly influence strategic initiatives, sales growth, and operational efficiency. You’ll be part of a legacy organization that's evolving rapidly—and you’ll help write the next chapter.
We are seeking a Data & Reporting Analyst to work cross-functionally between Finance, Sales, and Operations, helping to bridge the gap between data collection and strategic execution. This individual will play a critical role in transforming raw ERP data into actionable insights and accurate executive-level reporting to support key business decisions.
Position Summary
This is a high-impact role suited for someone with strong technical aptitude in ERP systems, Crystal Reports, and business intelligence tools. While this is not a CFO role, the ideal candidate should demonstrate financial fluency, comfort with inventory/sales metrics, and the ability to surface insights across purchasing, sales, margin, pricing, and freight.
You will work with leadership across departments (including Finance, Sales, Branch Operations, and IT) to build reports, analyze trends, and ensure data consistency from Epicor Prophet 21 and other systems.
Key Responsibilities
ERP Reporting & Data Analysis
● Serve as the subject matter expert in data extraction from Epicor Prophet 21, including building and refining Crystal Reports, Smart Forms, and SQL-based queries.
● Conduct detailed analysis on sales, margins, inventory turns, freight recovery, pricing strategies, and purchasing trends.
● Monitor and improve the integrity of data flowing between ERP, CRM, Recurrency, and eCommerce (Magento).
Financial & Operational Insights
● Partner with Finance to support monthly branch reporting, budget vs. actual reviews, and territory-level profitability dashboards.
● Create visual dashboards for executive leadership, showing key metrics like GM%, YTD revenue, freight impact, and customer segmentation (e.g., A/B/C/D/E).
● Support pricing and profitability analysis by segment, product line, rep performance, and customer type (redistributor vs. end-user).
Collaboration & Strategic Support
● Work with marketing and sales teams to ensure data alignment across marketing campaigns and sales enablement initiatives.
● Support the Sales PRO, CORE Pricing, and CWC Pro University initiatives with reliable data visualizations and performance tracking tools.
● Help automate repetitive reporting processes and migrate legacy spreadsheets to more scalable solutions.
Qualifications
● Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems, Finance, Data Science, or related field.
● 3–5 years of hands-on experience working with ERP systems (preferably Prophet 21) and Crystal Reports development
● Strong fluency in SQL, Excel (Pivot Tables, Power Query, VLOOKUPs), and data normalization techniques.
● Experience with BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Google Looker Studio.
● Familiarity with distribution, supply chain, and inventory workflows is a plus.
● Bonus: Exposure to APIs or data integrations between ERP, CRM, and eCommerce platforms.
Desired Attributes
● Detail-oriented with the ability to "zoom out" and connect data to business outcomes.
● Comfortable translating data into narrative for non-technical stakeholders.
● Strong interpersonal skills to collaborate across departments and levels.
● Able to handle multiple projects and manage deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Position Overview:
A Healthy and Organic Food, Ingredients, Beverage and Flavors manufacturer is searching for an experienced and innovative Business Systems Analyst.
About the role:
The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) plays a critical role in managing and optimizing the company’s business applications—particularly ERP, CRM, inventory, and quality systems—across all departments.
This person acts as the internal owner of business systems, working closely with cross-functional leaders and managing relationships with external IT and software vendors. The BSA ensures systems are aligned with operational, financial, and strategic goals, despite the absence of an internal IT department. The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) will bridge the gap between raw data and business decision-making, including data modeling, dashboard design, and user collaboration.
This is a hybrid role located in Addison, IL
Key Responsibilities:
System Ownership & Optimization
o Serve as the internal expert on ERP, CRM, and other core business systems.
o Document and optimize business processes across departments (Finance, Supply Chain, Sales, Quality).
o Manage system configurations, roles/permissions, dashboards, and reporting needs.
o Manage enterprise data visualization tools (e.g., Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, etc).
Cross-Functional Support
o Translate business needs into functional requirements for ERP and related systems.
o Support Finance with reporting, BOM costing, inventory reconciliations, and master data management.
o Work with Sales and Customer Service on CRM workflows and customer integration (EDI/portal).
Vendor & Project Management
o Act as point-of-contact with external IT service providers and consultants. o Lead small-to-mid-size system improvement or integration projects. o Coordinate upgrades, testing, and troubleshooting in partnership with vendors.
Reporting & Analytics
o Reporting & Analytics o Build and maintain operational and financial dashboards (e.g., in Excel, Power BI, or ERP reporting tools).
o Establish and uphold standards for data model documentation, dashboard layout, and performance. o Analyze system data to identify inefficiencies or improvement opportunities.
Governance & Data Integrity
o Maintain data accuracy and completeness across platforms.
o Ensure adherence to data security, change control, and audit protocols
Qualifications and Experience:
3–5+ years of experience in business systems analysis or similar role
3+ years of combined experience in data modeling, Power BI development, or related analytics roles.
Experience with ERP systems (NetSuite, Sage X3, or similar)
Strong understanding of business processes in manufacturing or food/CPG industries
Demonstrated ability to manage external IT vendors or MSPs
Strong Excel skills and familiarity with data/reporting tools
Power BI or similar dashboard/reporting experience
Familiarity with flavors or ingredients industry (batch production, BOMs, quality control)
Experience with CRM tools (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot), EDI, or PLM systems
Project management or Six Sigma experience a plus

About the Company:

Meneses Law is an accomplished law firm with an outstanding track record of providing immigration services with the highest professional standards to our clients. We work with thousands of clients across the United States on Adjustment of Status, Visas, Petitions, Labor Certifications, Citizenships, Deportations, Waivers, DACA Renewals, and Asylum matters.

Our headquarters is based out of Houston, Texas and with the expansion to other major cities, our aim is to assist clients to achieve their objectives as placidly and efficiently as possible while minimizing the legal and regulatory risks. The law firm is built on its reputation of providing exceptional customer service delivery coupled with appropriate and outstanding skills, fast turnaround, and the know-how expert of our legal team.

Job Summary:
Meneses Law is seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting data to provide valuable insights that will drive decision-making and improve operational efficiency. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a passion for transforming data into actionable strategies. If you're a problem-solver with experience in data analysis, we want to hear from you!

Essential Functions/ Responsibilities:
Collect and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights for business decision-making.
Utilize statistical techniques and data visualization tools to present findings clearly and effectively.
Work with cross-functional teams to identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide data-driven recommendations.
Analyze trends, patterns, and correlations to support strategic business decisions and improve operations.
Create and maintain automated reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.
Identify opportunities for process optimization and propose data-driven solutions to improve business outcomes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by cleaning and validating data before analysis.
Collaborate with other teams to enhance data collection methods and refine reporting processes.
Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization.
Perform any other tasks or functions deemed necessary to the daily operations of the employer.
Required Skills/ Abilities:
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R) and data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills with an eye for detail.
Ability to analyze and interpret complex datasets and present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Experience with statistical analysis and creating data-driven insights.
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate findings effectively.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant data tools.
Ability to work independently and take initiative in problem-solving.
Job Types: Full-time
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2 years of experience in a data analysis or related role.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data analysis software (Python, R, etc.).
Knowledge of statistical analysis and modeling techniques.
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and meet deadlines.
Strong communication skills to present findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Compensation:
Meneses Law believes in Work Life Balance. Operation hours are from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. plus 2 Saturdays a month for certain positions.
Being hired by Meneses Law as a Data Analyst means that you will have the opportunity to:

Start an incredible career.

Job Description:
Overview
The Data Quality Assurance Analyst plays a critical role in ensuring and improving data quality across the organization. Reporting to the Data Governance Manager, this highly independent and proactive position will be expected to identify opportunities for improvement, establish and execute data quality assurance processes, and work closely with cross-functional teams to tackle complex data challenges. This role involves meticulous data analysis, identification of inconsistencies, implementation of quality improvement initiatives, and adherence to rigorous healthcare data standards. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with expertise in healthcare data systems and a deep understanding of healthcare data standards, regulations, and compliance requirements.
Key Responsibilities
Lead the Data Quality Taskforce, coordinating efforts to improve data quality standards and practices across the organization.
Gather data quality metrics and analytics to assess the current state and identify areas for improvement and standardization.
Set data quality priorities in collaboration with stakeholders and business units.
Collaborate with Reporting & Advanced Analytics Department and technical data stewards to develop and maintain data quality dashboards for monitoring purposes.
Create processes for teams to effectively monitor their respective data quality dashboards and proactively identify potential data quality issues for investigation and resolution.
Collaborate with technical and business stakeholders to design and execute systematic data quality checks and validation procedures that promote accuracy, completeness, consistency, and reliability of healthcare data.
Perform root cause analysis on identified data discrepancies and work collaboratively with technical and business stakeholders to resolve issues.
Support the development, implementation, and ongoing improvement of data quality assurance frameworks, testing methodologies, and best practices in collaboration with IT and business data stewards, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
Proactively perform quality assurance on all data deliverables, researching and reconciling discrepancies across healthcare information systems and reports.
Maintain high data quality standards to ensure that reports and analyses are accurate, timely, and reliable, enabling confident decision-making.
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of data quality policies and procedures, ensuring they reflect industry standards and organizational needs, in partnership with IT teams and business units.
Collaborate with IT teams, business stewards, and technical data stewards to improve the quality of data and information flows.
Ensure compliance with healthcare industry standards and regulatory requirements, including HIPAA.
Oversee the curation progress of the data catalog, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and usability.
Compile a comprehensive list of documents and sources for catalog curation; develop a curation roadmap and prioritize catalog enhancement initiatives.
Assist the Data Governance Manager with various data governance initiatives as required.
Knowledge, Experience, & Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Healthcare Informatics, or a related technical field; Master’s degree preferred.
3–5 years of experience in data quality assurance, data governance, data analysis, or related roles, preferably in healthcare.
Hands-on experience with healthcare data systems (e.g., Epic including Tapestry, Claims, Enrollment modules).
Strong understanding of healthcare data standards, regulations, and compliance requirements.
In-depth knowledge of healthcare data sets, including clinical, claims, financial, and operational data.
Proficiency in querying languages such as SQL.
Experience with data governance/data catalog tools such as Alation.
Strong understanding of data governance principles and how they relate to data quality
Proficiency in techniques to analyze and clean data to report and improve its quality
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple projects, and problem-solve under tight deadlines.
Clear written and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Self-starter mindset with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-oriented, organized, and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM is a plus.

Hybrid schedule

company_name: Jewish Federation of South Palm Beach County
job_description:
Drive Financial Excellence and Transform Systems
We’re seeking a strategic and detail-driven Financial Systems Reporting Analyst to be a key partner in our Finance team’s evolution. This is more than just a finance role, it’s an opportunity to bridge finance and technology, ensuring our new ERP system delivers powerful insights and operational efficiency while upholding compliance and accuracy.
As the vital link between Finance and IT, you’ll play a leading role in implementing, migrating, and optimizing NetSuite, shaping the future of our financial systems and reporting. Your expertise will empower our leadership with timely, precise financial data to support impactful decision-making.
Role and Impact
As our Financial Systems Reporting Analyst, you will support the CFO and Finance team by managing monthly financial reporting, driving budget and forecast accuracy, and leading our ERP implementation. Your efforts will ensure that our financial data is trustworthy and accessible, and that our new system elevates how we operate and report.
Key Responsibilities:
Financial Reporting & Analysis
Prepare and analyze detailed financial statements and budget-to-actual variance reports.
Deliver timely internal reports and executive summaries that inform strategic planning.
Budget & Forecasting Support
Assist the CFO with developing accurate mid-year and year-end projections.
Help design and improve departmental and consolidated budgets.
Cross-Functional Collaboration
Build strong relationships across departments to ensure data integrity in the general ledger.
Support audits and compliance activities by preparing required documentation.
ERP Implementation & Optimization
Lead configuration, data migration, testing, and training for the transition to NetSuite.
Partner with vendors and stakeholders to align the system with organizational needs.
Streamline processes and automate workflows to enhance operational efficiency.
Document procedures and provide ongoing support post-implementation
Thrive Here If You Have:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field.
8-10 years of experience in financial reporting, audits, and internal controls.
Strong expertise in GAAP and nonprofit accounting principles.
Minimum 3 years hands-on NetSuite experience, including full-cycle implementation.
Advanced Excel skills with proficiency in pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, and macros.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Effective communication skills to translate complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and work collaboratively.
Bonus: Experience migrating from Financial Edge Blackbaud or similar systems.
Why You Should Work Here
We believe meaningful work happens in a mission-driven, supportive environment. When you join us, you’ll enjoy:
Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunities for professional growth and skill development
The chance to lead a transformative ERP project that shapes how we work
Collaborative culture committed to innovation and impact
Work-life balance and respect for your time and contributions
The Jewish Federation of South Palm Beach County is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, and veteran or disability status.
